description: MANILA, Aug. 6  More than 100 farmers, who had planted crops in idle land they did not own on the island of Negros were taken to a military stockade in Bago City last week, it was learned today from a Roman Catholic Church task force for detainees. A priest helping them also was detained briefly.

title: Shipper's Failure Raises Maritime Issues
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Pacific Far East Line, controlled by the family of this city's former mayor, Joseph L. Alioto, faces liquidation here at the end of a 10year struggle to remain afloat.

title: Roland Stein Weds Miss Louis, Student
description: Jennifer Louis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. N. Herbert Louis of New York and Rye, N.Y., was married yesterday to Roland Stein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Helmut Stein of Millbrae, Calif.

title: For Kim Linehan, the Prize Was Well Worth the Pain
description: THE WOODLANDS, TEX. WHEN eight finalists were called to the blocks here last week for the start of the women's 400meter freestyle, the opening event of the Amateur Athletic Union's national longcourse swimming championships, 14yearold Cynthia Woodhead of Riverside, Calif., pulled her gogglesover her head and turned to hug her closest friend and fiercest freestyle rival, Stephanie Elkins of Gainesville, Fla.

title: Future of Interest Rates Divides Market Experts
description: After scoring their biggest gains for a single week since their rampage in December 1976, the credit markets now are trying figure out where to go from here, and the experts are deeply divided about the outlook.

title: Chess:
description: BAGUIO, the Philippines, Aug. 6 Viktor Korctuioi, the challenger in the world chess championship match here in the Baguio Convention Center, reluctantly agreed to a draw in his ninth game with the champion, Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union. The score is now Karpov 1, Korchnoi 0, with eight draws.

title: MidManhattan Bikeways aCyclist' Heaven in Traffic
description: Despite problems with doubleparkers, potholes and clothesrack jockeys in the garment district, bicycle riders are giving qualified raves to the midManhattan bikeways established two weeks ago along Broadway and the Avenue of the Americas.

title: Rain Postpones So.Orange Tennis
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug.6 .The semifinals in the $75,000 Grand Prix tennis championships were, poStponed by a heavy rain tonight at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: In Rome, Some Prayed,. Curiosity Moved Others
description: ROME, Aug. 6  Several thousand people heard the news of Pope Paul VI's death tonight while attending a performance of Verdi's Aida at the outdoor theater at the ruins of the Caracalla Baths.

title: India Evacuates Flood Victims
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 6 (Reuters)  Indian army units today evacuated hundreds of people marooned by floods in northern India. At least 92 villages in the states of Uttar Pradesh and Punjab have been flooded following heavy rains, and more than 25,000 people were marooned, the Press Trust of India reported.

title: Can the Brewers Keep Their Mr. Right?
description: DAVE Bristol, the Milwaukee Brewers first manager, was too rough. Del Crandall, the second, was too easy. Alex Grammas, the third, couldn't communicate with the players.

title: Defending Helsinki
description: The rising clamor for unilateral abrogation of the Helsinki accord is consonant neither with the hopes of Soviet dissenters nor with our role as a champion of human rights.

title: Washington Watch
description: ONE of the antiinflation ideas being talked about here is rolling back the minimum wage. Another increaseto $2.90 an hour from $2.65 an hour  is scheduled to take effect on Jan. 1.

title: CARDINALS TO MEET TO ELECT SUCCESSOR
description: The election of a successor to Pope Paul VI, a historic transfer of spiritual leadership and a drama of great solemnity and suspense, will be the responsibility of 116 Cardinals from throughout the world who will gather in the Vatican as the Sacred College of Cardinals in the next 15 to 18 days.

title: Price Surge Of Gold Felt By Jewelers
description: With gold's recent price leap over the $200anounce hurdle, dramatic price increases for jewelry are expected, starting late this month. And those increases would follow a steady trend, for gold prices have been creeping upward all year.

title: To Preserve New York's Heritage
description: When the New York State Senate reconvenes this week in its handsome, historic State Capitol, it might consider the fate of numerous stateowned structures of similar architectural quality as well as more modest but equally valuable examples of New York's heritage in other cities and towns. The Senate need hardly lift a finger in this warm weather to do so; it has had waiting for approval since June an excellent historic preservation bill, already passed unanimously by the Assembly.

title: Several Families Are Sent Away From Niagara Falls Landfill Site
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Aug. 6  A dozen or more families were moved from the contaminated Love Canal landfill site to temporary quarters yesterday and today as offers of more permanent homes came in.

title: 6,000 Demonstrators Greet U.N. Diplomat In SouthWest Africa
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Aug. 6 (Reuters) The United Nations special envoy, Martii Ahtisaari, arrived today to begin an effort to bring independence to this South Africanruled territory, also called Namibia. He said at an airport news conference that he would be impartial to all parties in the territory.

title: POLICY ON LANGUAGE ANGERS SOUTH INDIA
description: COCHIN, India  In a suburb of this steamy south Indian seaport, a young Government clerk stays up late at night, studying Hindi  a language that almost no one here speaks  because he fears that without it, there's no future in the job.

title: News Summary
description: Pope Paul VI diedafter a heart attack at his summer home at Castel Gandolfo. Giovanni Battista Montini, the 262d occupant of the Throne of St. Peter, was 80 years old. Elected Pope in 1963, he brought about many changes in the liturgy and organization of the Roman Catholic Church and closer relations with Protestant and Eastern Orthodox Christians. [Page A1, Column 6].

title: Leon Lewis Talk Show Going on WEVDFM
description: Leon Lewis will bring his telephone talk show to radio station WEVDFM starting Aug. 14. The program,in which he fields calls from listeners, will be heard nightly from midnight to 5 A.M. Mr. Lewis had his own show for 10 years on WMCA until earlier this year.

title: Charter Claims Under Scrutiny
description: The Irving Trust Company said last week that it and the Civil Aeronatics Board were investigating claims for re: funds in connection with charter tours operated by the Nationwide Leisure Corporation, one of the country's largest operators of travel tours.

title: HardDriving Carey Hails, And Defends, Record
description: All the Governor's men had thought they were done for the day. That was what the day's official schedule had said, but as it turned out, the official schedule meant no more than the day's official speeches, which had not been delivered. And sothey found themselves sitting at a corner gasoline station somewhere in Nassau County, in weather wittingly warm, being informed that after Belmont Race Track, Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center and a reception in Garden City, Mr. Carey had decided to move on at 7 P.M. on a Friday night to an unscheduled stop at an Italian feast in Glen Cove.

title: Queen's Banker Stays Selective
description: LONDONSeveral times each week a horsedrawn black coach clops up to the headquarters of Coutts & Company near Trafalgar Square.

title: Earnings For Quarter Rise 16.1%
description: Corporate earnings surged to record in the second quarter, with virtually every industry contributing to the rise, a Citibank survey of 1,613 corporations indicates.

title: Options
description: FOR certain players in the options market, the next two weeks promise to be exciting, indeed. All August options expire after the market close on the 18th of this month  just 10 trading days away  and for the venturesome players in this game, the situation is somewhat akin to a relief pitcher entering with the score tied or perhaps with his team a run behind.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RECORDS AND ROOTSThe public is invited to two new exhibitions opening today, one presented at the country's only permanent art gallery in a union headquarters and the other at a new, noncommercial gallery sponsored by the Government of Venezuela.

title: ABC Plans Inquiry on Gang Film
description: ABCTV announced last night that would hire outside counsel to investigate charges that scenes in an documentary on New York City youth gangs had been staged.

title: TALKING BUSINESS Texaco Cautious About Offshore Oil
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  Two weeks ago, Texaco Inc. disclosed that it had shows of hydrocarbons at its offshore drilling site in the Baltimore Canyon trough approximately 100 miles due east of Atlantic City.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Mierodata Corporation, Irvine, Calif., worldwide manufacturer and marketer of business computer systems, keytodisk data entry equipment, and peripherals, has named Jack A. Bertch vice president sales.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Trading stamps are not coming back, says Harry Greenough. They can't because they never left.

title: Rowdyism Afflicts the Pastime
description: BASEBALL helmets are normally worn to protect against a pitcher's fastball, but Richie Zisk and Bobby Bonds of thb Texas Rangers recently donned their hard hats to protect themselves from spark plugs, ice cubes and firecrackers tossed by Chicago White Sox fans.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WKCR.Motets and Madrigals, Gesualdo and Monteverdi.

title: Liquid Propane Tank Car Derails And Explodes Near Illinois Town
description: COLLINSVILLE, Ill., Aug. 6 (UPI) About 200 residents were evacuated from their homes early today because of an explosion and fire in a derailed railroad tank car carrying liquid propane gas.

title: Mary C. Smith, a Buyer, Wed to Brett L. Roberts
description: The marriage of Mary Christine Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Smith of White Plains, to Brett L. Roberts took place in Purchase, N.Y., yesterday. Rabbi Abraham Klausner performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Bruce F. Roberts.

title: Energy In 2 Worlds
description: CHICAGO  There is a good deal of talk about Americans excessive and wasteful use of energy.

title: WHITES IN SALISBURY SEEM ALOOF TO WAR
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 6  As the guerrilla war tightens its grip on Rhodesia, visitors are increasingly struck by the complacency that pervades this sunwashed capital.,

title: Carter Striving To Ease Strains With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6  Like the suitor of a;reluctant maiden, Jimmy Carter has been pursuing Congress in recent weeks with everything from flattery to invitations to the White House.

title: Where to Wear an Arab Robe? To a Japanese Festival
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 6  It's no cinch for a somewhat Italianate building and a lot of more than somewhat occidental faces to look Javanese.

title: Pentathlon to Canadian
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Aug. 6 (AP)  Diane JonesKonihowski, performing before Queen Elizabeth and Canada's Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau, set Commonwealth and Commonwealth Games records in winning the women's pentathlon today.

title: Outdoors
description: PAWLEY'S ISLAND. S.C. IFOUND myself, early one morning recently, standing in a tidal marsh, chest deep in water, my feet sinking slowly into the muddy bottom, while I grasped one end of large net with one hand and used theother to swat away horseflies that seemed only slightly smaller than sparrows. What I was doing in this rather awkward position was trying to catch shrimp, and I soon discovered they are a lot shiftier than they appear to be when served up on a bed of lettuce and crushed ice.

title: Regina Burke Becomes Bride Of Kenneth Werner, Lawyer
description: The marriage of Regina Burke of New York to Kenneth David Werner took place yesterday at the home of the bridegroom's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jack C. Werner of Mamaroneck, N.Y. Rabbi Leonard Poller of Larchmont, N.Y., performed the ceremony.

title: Southern Ends 500 Airline jobs
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 6 (AP)  Southern Airways said that it was terminating the jobs of 500 employees  40 percent of them in Atlanta  because earnings had been too low to meet contracts signed for new aircraft.

title: Met. Golf to Burke Jr.
description: GARDEN CITY, Li, Aug. 6  Mike Burke Jr. won the 76th Metropolitan Golf Association's amateur championship today over the rainswept Garden City Golf Club course. Burke defeated Clement Miner Jr., 3 and I.

title: Deaths
description: KARSTADTSeymour, beloved husband of Florence (nee Cohen), devoted father of Lynda Krantz. SharYn Blaustein and Keith, dear brother of Herbert and Lester, and five grandchildren. Services Monday, 1 PM, Schoem Menorah Chapel, W. 150 Rte A, Paramus, N.J.

title: Jesse Haines, Pitcher, Dies at 85; Hall of Farner Won 210 Games
description: Jesse (Pop) Haines, a Hall of Paine pitcher who starred with the St. Louis Cardinals in the 1920's and 30's, died on Saturday in Columbus, Ohio. He was 85 years old.

title: Politics Aside, Cuba Is Festive for Visiting Young Leftists
description: HAVANA, Cuba, Aug. 6  Most of the delegates to the 11th International Youth Festival were caught off guard. Almost 20,000 young leftists came from 195 countries expecting to participate only in solemn ceremonies condemning imperialism. But the Cuban people had carnival in mind.

title: Dibbs Wins Final, 64, 64
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H. Aug. 6 (AP) - Eddie Dibbs slugged, volleyed and smashed his way to victory today over the defending champion, John Alexander, to win by 64, 64, in the final of the $175,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament at Mt. Cranmore Stadium.

title: Miss Caulkins Wins 5th Title
description: THE WOODLANDS, Tex., Aug. 6 (AP) Tracy Caulkins, with one world record and three American records already to her credit, won her fifth race with an American record of 2 minutes 35.23 seconds in the 200nteter breaststroke today in the Amateur Athletic Union longcourse swimming championships.

title: Teamsters Backed on Pensions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6  The Justice Department has sided with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters in a controversial lawsuit brought by former union member who alleges that he was defrauded of his pension benefits by his union pension fund.

title: Who Will Be Next Pope? Cardinals to Meet Without Clear Favorite
description: There will be no clear favorite when the College of Cardinals meets in Rome later this month to choose a new Pope, according to the few students of the Roman Catholic Church who allow themselves to speculate openly about the successor to pone paul VI

title: Japan Shipping Hard Hit
description: IUKYU, Aug. 6 The Transport Ministry says that the Japanese shipping industry, whose survival depends on carrying international cargoes, has been seriously affected financially by profitdisregarding, ratecutting competition from the Soviet Union.

title: Jill Nancy Kessler Is Wed To Mitchell B. Freinberg
description: Jill Nancy Kessler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward L. Kessler of South Orange, N.J., was married yesterday at her parents home, to Mitchell Bennett Freinberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard B. Freinberg, also of South Orange. Cantor Norman Summers of Short Hills, N.J., performed the ceremony.

title: Ford Dealers Survey Stock Holdings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6  The Ford Dealer Alliance, which represents 1,200 of the 6,500 Ford and LincolnMercury dealers around the nation, is surveying all Ford Motor Company dealers to determine how much stock they own in the company.

title: Archbishop of Canterbury Cites Pope's Devotion to the Church
description: LONDON, Aug. 6 (Reuters)  Dr. Donald Coggan, Archbishop of Canterbury and primate of the Anglican Church, said here that the death of Pope Paul VI tonight brings to an end a period which held within it great difficulty for the leader of the Roman Catholic Church

title: Boston School Chief Brings Expertise on Urban Ills
description: BOSTON, Aug. 4  Boston just might be the one Northern city, Robert C. Wood believes, that will be able to increase the white proportion of enrollment in its schools after deseereeation.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in Business Day on Friday reported incorrectly that a New York State judge had upheld the right of the American Institute of Public Accountants to establish a new class of membership. In fact the judge upheld the institute's establishment of a separate division for large acccounting firms on the ground that the new structure did not constitute a separate class of membership.

title: Deaths
description: NICKELEthel J. Boynton. Died yesterday at Meadow Lakes Infirmary, Hlghtstown, N.J., aged 85 years, formerly of Stanton N.J., beloved wife of Henry W. Nickel, Sr., beloved mother of Jane Nickel Weldton, and Henry Jr., also survived by 5 grand and 1 great grandchild. All services will be private. For Further information contact The Never Funeral Home, 202 Stockton Street, Hightstown, N.J.

title: Portugal Leader's Deadline Passes For Forming a Governing Coalition
description: LISBON, Aug. 6  The deadline for Portugal's political parties to come up with a parliamentary solution to the latest Government crisis passed tonight amid growing signs that President Antonio Ramalho Eanes would appoint a prime minister of his own choosing to govern this new and still shaky European democracy.

title: Books of TheTirnes
description: NATURALLY I never bet on football games or play in gambling casinos. Neither do you. Still, there is a new Atlantic City rising beside the oil spills along the Jersey shore, while Las Vegas endures, only a junket away.

title: 2 Giants Set for Big Test
description: BRAD Benson was teaching elementary school in Altoona, Pa., and J.T. Turner was teaching the children of the migrant workers who pick the fruit in the orchards of upstate New York. Itwas the offseason and two players on the margin of the National Football League were pursuing their alternate careers.

title: Levitt Audit Attacks Audit by Comptroller Goldin
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt, in an audit of an audit by Harrison J. Goldin, the New York City Comptroller, has described the Goldin audit as flawed, deficient and unverified.

title: Carter Striving To Ease Strains With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6  Like the suitor of a reluctant maiden, Jimmy Carter has been pursuing Congress in recent weeks with everything from flattery to invitations to the White House.

title: U.S.India Import Pact Completed
description: GENEVA, Aug. 6  The United States and India have concluded an agreement providing for reduced American import duties on a range of Indian products and liberalized procedures for Indian imports of American goods.

title: The Run on the Fed
description: The Federal Reserve System is a mighty institution. Its chairman is one of Washington's most powerful individuals and its impact on the economy, through the manipulation of credit and interest rates is immediate and farreaching. It is surprising, therefore, to find that some people are deeply worried about the Fed's abiding strength. In the the oast eight years. 430 smalland mediumsized banks have left the Fed System become statechartered banks. To put its finger in the dike before too many more of the remaining 5,668 banks slip away, the Fed has proposed a profound change in the way the national banking system operates. It wants to pay member banks interest on the $38 billion of reserves they must hold and to charge these members for services now provided free.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A homemade bomb exploded at Parks Department garage in Queens early yesterday morning, destroying three cityowned vehicles and damging three others.

title: MANY VOICE SADNESS
description: Across the nation and the world, the. powerful and the average parishioner yesterday mourned the man who for 15 years had been the spiritual leader of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Advertising
description: ONE of the assignments Pan American World Airways gave the four finalist agencies cornpeting for its account was to create advertising campaigns introducing the airline to a select number of domestic routes, for which each of the four were compensated $10,000.

title: 3 BEACHES REOPENED AS OIL IS DISPERSED
description: Parks Commissioner Gordon J. Davis reopened Coney Island, Brighton, and Manhattan beaches at 1 P.M. yesterday, saying that nearly all of the 37,000 gallons of oil that poured from a barge that sank off Rockaway Point last Monday had been dispersed by 900 city workers, private contractors, and the Coast Guard.

title: Consumers Expand Debt
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)  Consumers continued their installment borrowing at a hectic pace in June, increasing their debts by $3.8 billion, the Federal Reserve reported this weekend.

title: Deaths
description: ORBERArthur B. The entire New Jersey Division of the National Asthma Center at Denver Is deeply affected by the sudden death of Arthur B. Lorber, National President Emeritus. The respect, love and energy he gave to the institution will continue to live within us. We had the rare good fortune to learn from him candor, more Insight, more humility and surer judgement. We extend our heartfelt sorrow to wife Louise and brother Dr. Milton. May they find comfort in having been a part of his life.

title: Mahaffey Captures P.G.A. In a ThreeMan Playoff
description: OAKMONT, Pa., Aug. 6  John Drayton Mahaffey won the 60th Professional Golfers Association championship today after a stirring finalround 66 and two olavoff holes.

title: Claudia Schur Wed To Neal Goldfarb
description: Claudia Laiken Schur, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Leon Schur of Milwaukee, was married there yesterday to Neal Andrew Goldfarb, son of Dr. and Mrs. Jerry Goldfarb of Stamford, Conn. Rabbi Harry Pastor performed the ceremony at the Schur home.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Two Connecticut groups said they would file a lawsuit this week against New Jersey and New York to force the two states to reduce air pollution that they charged was responsible for much of Connecticut's airpollution problem.

title: SECURITY TIGHTENED BY PAKISTANI POLICE
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Aug. 6 (Reu ers)  The Pakistani police watched ai ports and increased guards on foreig diplomatic missions today after gunme killed four men at the Palestinian Liben tion Organization's offices here in Pak stan's capital.

title: Up, Up and Away In the Sweetness Of Sunrise
description: THERE it goes, floating by, bobbing low, climbing high: a sevenstory glistening nylon globe stnum to a wicker gondola, borne gently by the breeze, skimming lakes, touching trees, teasing viewers below.

title: De Gustibus The Rich History Of Russian Dressing
description: The pursuit of history where food is concerned is at times almost as gratifying as the act of cooking and eating. For one reason or another, it is generally easier to uncover the sources of dishes in French cooking than those of the traditional American table.

title: Dances for Summer Are Presented
description: THERE has been a dance program this summer at All Angels Church, where events have included classes, workshops and lecturedemonstrations. Saturday evening's attraction was a concert called Dances for Summer '78, presented in the parish hall. Although the participants included some experienced performers, their choreographic efforts smacked of composition class studies.

title: Draths
description: LORBERArthur (Buemey) The New York Office of The National Asthma Center at Denver loins with the thousands of volunteers across the county who mourn the loss of our President Emeritus His entire life was dedicated to serving His Children at the National Asthma Center/CARIH. His leadership and friendship will long be remembered. Our heartfelt sorrow is extended to his wile Louise and brother Dr. Milton.

title: Some Issues Show Gains On Plans to Split Stocks
description: Announcement of stocksplit plans sent several issues ahead yesterday, but the general market turned in a mixed performance, as if exhausted by last week's smart gains and record trading volume.

title: Talks Intensify as Threatened Pressmen's Strike Nears
description: Negotiators for the pressmen's union and for the city's three major daily newspapers intensified their efforts yesterday to resolve their contract dispute over press manning and avert a strike threatened for today. The talks, which ended late last night, were scheduled to resume this morning.

title: A.C.L.U. Supports Group Fighting Passaic County Weekly Newspaper
description: PATERSON, Aug. 7  The New Jersey Chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union filed a friend of the court brief today on behalf of a group of Clifton residents seeking to curtail subscriptions as well as legal and commercial advertising in a weekly newspaper, The Independent Prospector, whose news content they find obiectionable.

title: On Heels, There's No Firm Stand
description: In the new formality that has been introduced by the French couture, highheeled shoes are as integral part of the fall fashion picture as the forwardtilted disk hat. As the models swept down the runways of the Paris salons recently, they invariably wore three and even fourinch heels, whether they were dressed for day or for night.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Gold bullion prices advanced further on both sides of the Atlantic yesterday, propelled in large part by a weaker dollar and rumors that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries will meet next month to discuss raising crudeoil prices by 5 percent.

title: Paulus Sixtus
description: The death of a Pope brings a pause in the whirl time, a moment to look backwards and into the future, the sort of double vision particularly appropriate at the death of the man born Giovanni Battista Montini. Pope Paul VI, as he became 15 years ago, strdddled two eras, faced with the dilemma of retaining the immutable stability of the Church while pursuing the change necessary for it to survive.

title: Patricia Harris Balks at Testifying
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 7 Patricia Roberts Harris, Secretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development, canceled her appearance today before the House Banking Committee rather than tone down her criticism of the Federal Reserve Board's monetary policy, as the White House had ordered her to, Congressional sources reported.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Down; (000 omitted in dollar tirpures)
description: Yields declined on Treasury bills in the weekly auction yesterday in both the 91day and 182day maturities.

title: Smith Narrowly Misses IndividualMedley Record
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Graham Smith, missing the world record by onehundreth of a second, collected his third and Canada's eighth swimming gold medal at the Commonwealth Games today with a narrow victroy in the men's 200meter individual medley.

title: Advertising
description: THE way Ron Sherman tells it, he was interviewing Arthur Cohen for a possible executive post at the J. Walter Thompson Company and came to the conclusion that Mr. Cohen, most recently vice president and director of marketing at Bloomingdale's, was ideally suited for an entrepreneurialrole of some kind.

title: Patricia Harris Balks at Testifying
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 7  Patricia Roberts Harris, Secretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development, canceled her appearance today before the House Banking Committee rather than tone down her criticism of the Federal Reserve Board's monetary policy, as the White House had ordered her to, Congressional sources reported.

title: It's Technology to the Rescue of DriveIn Movie Theaters
description: The drivein theater, that passion pit of teenage.romance and the cheap night out for parents who could not afford babysitter, was once heralded as the salvation of a movie industry under siege by television. Nowadays, the moviehouses are doing much better and it is the drivein that is in need of help.

title: Tie New York Times/Jack Manning
description: NE LCOMED VOLUNTEERS: Youngsters joined in yesterday to help their city. They gathered at 53d Street and ington Avenue to lend a hand with cleanup operations and received appreciative glances from passersby.

title: Broadway Limbering Up For Season
description: ASIGN that Broadway is getting ready for the new theatrical season has been the flurry of energetic noises  talk, song, dancers footbeats  sounding from the studios where the musical King of Hearts went into rehearsal a few days aeo.

title: Deaths
description: SCHAEFFERMarion. Paskus, Gor don and Hyman, its partners, asses ciates and staff extend their deepes: sympathy and sincerest condolences to their partner Philip H. Schaef ter upon the untimely death of his wife Marion.

title: Macy Denies Field Stock Bid
description: In response to persistent Wall Street rumors, R. H. Macy & Company denied yesterday that it was buying up stock of Marshall Field & Company, following heavierthan,usual trading of Field stock last Friday and yesterday.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, AUD. 7, 1978

title: Output of Steel Rises by 3.7%
description: Steel production rose to 2.64 million net tons in the week ended Aug. 5, an increase of 3.7 percent over the preceding week's 2.55 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Big Asian Conglomerate Is Seeking Acquisitions
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia Southeast Asia's largest conglomerate, Sime Darby, is on the acquisition trail. To finance its purchases, it is raising more than $200 million from the Singapore and Kuala Lumpur capital markets. It is the largest cnrrinratp Irian ever sought here and is causing a flutter in the business community, with Sime keeping everyone guessing about what it intends to do with the money.

title: Critic's Notebook
description: PERHAPS it was inevitable. institutions come and go. Now it is Town Hall's time. The venerable (by New York standards) concert and lecture hall will close on Aug. 31, perhaps for good. Not with a bang, not even with a whimper. There will he nn great farewell evening on the stage that has been graced by the likes of Fritz Kreisler, John McCormack, the Budapest Quartet, Lotte Lehmann, Sergei Rachmaninoff, Elisabeth Schwarzkopf. Nobody is rising in wrath, as concerned people did when the future of Carnegie Hall was threatened. At least on Sept. 12, at 10:30 A.M. in City Hall, admirers of Town Hall will ask the Landmarks Commission to keep the auditorium as a national treasure.

title: Meanwhile, DriveIn Restaurants Fade Away
description: The death knell has already sounded for another manifestation of the carcrazed society, the drivein restaurant.

title: Georgia to Pick Candidates Today; Incumbents Regarded as Favorites
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 7  Georgians will nominate candidates for Governor and the United States Senate and House tomorrow, with incumbents apparently firmly entrenched. The Democratic Governor, George Busbee, has five primary opponents, but polls and political observers predict a landslide victory for him. pnmary is one of four to be held tomorrow. The others are in Michigan, Idaho and Missouri.

title: E. M. Seay, a Hotel Publicity Man
description: Edward M. Seay, a retired publicrelations man who helped establish and maintain a succession of midtown hotels as headquarters of New York society, died last Friday at his home at 227 East 57th Street. He was 77 years old. in a career uiat spanned nearly 50 years, Mr. Seay helped plan and publicize the comingout parties, weddings and charity balls of generations of debutantes and dowagers, as often as not at whatver hotel Mr. Seay happened to be representing at the moment.

title: Mondale May Attend Funeral for Pope Paul
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Vice President Mondale is expected to head the United States delegation to the funeral of Pope Paul VI, Administration officials said today.

title: City Hall Plans Historic Touch For Carter Visit
description: New York City and White House aides swarmed over City Hall yesterday, making final preparations for President Carter's trip here today to sign the Federal loanguarantee bill, the keystone, of the city's long fight to avert bankruptcy.

title: Splendor for Senators
description: The latest marble boondoggle will have woodpanelled offices with 16foot ceilings, rise nine stories high and have a rooftop restaurant and. two private baths in every office. The imperial Presidency may be dead but the spirit of Mussolini lingers on.

title: EARNINGS
description: The Loews Corporation reported yesterday that its profit from operations in the second quarter almost doubled compared with. like three months of 1977. However, because of a $44.2 million gain from the sale of its international cigarette business in the 1977 quarter, the. Loews net income declined 36 percent.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A bill that would create a new state Department of Commerce and Economic Development to help stem the exodus of industry from New Jersey was released yesterday by the Senate State Government, Federal and Interstate Relations and Veterans Affairs Committee. The committeevoted unanimously to release the bill fora full Senate vote.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Tropical storm  Bess  is represented by a concentrated cloud circulation over the eastern coast of Mexico. Showers and thunderstorms are embedded in the sprawling cloud mass over the East. Generally clear skies cover the Plains States and the Far West. Fast moving weather fronts are tracking across Canada from west to east under the influence of a moderate jet stream wind.

title: GOING OUT
description: TONES AND TEAMS In tonight's 8 o'clock concert of the Washington Square Music Festival, Henry Schuman will lead the festival orchestra in three serenades by Mozart, Dvorak and Richard Strauss. The morning program for children near the park's fountain at 11 o'clock features a performance by Jim. Moore, a street mime. In case of rain, the programs will take place in New York University's Loeb Student Center, 506 La Guardia Place, on the perk's southern border.

title: Canada Said to Win Indonesian Coal Job
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 7 Canadian companies have won the first round in the tittle for a billion.dollar coal mining and power station prtiject in Indonesia, according to informed sources here.

title: Moynihan Sees Need For Bill to Guarantee Freedom of the Press
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Deploring the jailing of M. A. Farber, a New York Times reporter, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan said today that Congress might have to act to assure continued freedom of the oress.

title: Beatrice, Tropicana In Merger
description: The Beatrice Food Company and Tropicana Products Inc., acting 17 minutes after expiration of a Federal Appeals Court delay, announced jointly yesterday that the two companies had merged. Beatrice will now pay Tropicana stockholders some $488 million in cash and stock.

title: As Rain Aids Attendance, Law Parley Weighs Both the Frivolous And the Serious Ammo
description: At the American Bar Association convention, which will end here on Wednesday, hundreds of meetings are held, ranging from the vaguely frivolous to the practical to the serious. Attendance at these sessions in the last few days seems to have paralleled the intensity of the rain outside.

title: MARK LANE CHARGES PANEL CONSPIRACY
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 7  An attorney for James Earl Ray, the convicted killer of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., said today that the House Select Committee on Assassinations had violated the law and its own rules as a part of a conspiracy to prevent a fair investigation of the assassination, which took place in Memphis 10 years ago. m ne lawyer, Mark Lane, said in a statement issued here that the committee's investigators and their agents had suborned perjury, criminally received stolen property and monitored and taperecorded telephone conversations.

title: Knicks Trying Cabrera's Latin Touch. in Backcourt
description: Back home, Hugo Cabrera is called The Maestro. On West 99th Street in Manhattan, and on George Washington Boulevard in Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. he is a hero.

title: United Press International
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 7  A crowd of pilgrims and the curious filed past the body of Pope Paul VI this morning at the papal summer residence.

title: South African Cleric Released
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 8 (AP)  A leading Anglican churchman in the Botswana district was released yesterday after being held in South African police headquarters since July 26, according to The Johannesburg Star. The Rev. MiChael Molale, 45, was arrested at an airport in Johannesburg. He was formerly a priest in the black townships of Sharpeville and Soweto and has been active in assisting South African refugees in Botswana.

title: Associated Press
description: HEADING FOR WORLD GAMES: Greg Louganis making his final dive off the 10meter platform at the A.A.U. outdoor diving championships Sunday in Mission Viejo, Calif. Louganis won the event by 96 points over the secondplace finisher, Mark Virts. Both will compete in the World Aquatic Games, which will be held in Berlin later this month.

title: Seychelles, in Warning on Arms, Threatens to Bar Military Ships
description: VICTORIA, Seychelles, Aug 7 (Reuters)  The leader of the Seychelle Islands said today that the country's ports would be closed to military vessels tiom any nation that hurt the cause of peace in the Indian Ocean by increasing its military strength there.

title: Carey Promises State Aid to Victims of Pollution
description: President Carter approved Federal emergency financial aid last night for the Love Canal area of Niagara Falls, N.Y., where chemical leakage from an old landfill has endangered the healthpf residents whose backyards border the site.

title: Bomb Celebrates Paul's Death
description: RIMINI, Italy, Aug. 7 (AP)  Two firebombs were hurled against the gate of Franciscan monastery here before dawn today, starting a small fire. An anonymous telephone caller told a local newspaper the attack was meant to celebrate the death of Pope Paul VI.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVINGTOMORROW, August 9 QUEEN ELIZABETH 2 (Cunard). Lett Cherbourg August 4; ducat 11 A.M. at W. S5th Street.

title: Associated Press
description: BATTLING CHEMICAL FIRE: Firefighters pulling burning drums of chemicals off platform of plant at Hickory, N.C., Sunday night as blaze forced evacuation of 300 townspeople for eights hours until it was brought under control.

title: Jules J. Justin, 74, An Attorney, And Arbitrator in Labor Disputes
description: Jules J. Justin, a lawyer and labor arbitrator in Manhattan for many years, died Saturday at Montefiore Hospital and Medical Center in the Bronx. He was 74 years old and lived in Mamaroneck, N. Y.

title: A. Camp at Tanglewood Makes Rossini Real to Urban Children
description: LENOX, Mass.  It was a typical scene of children just arrived at camp: a hodgepodge of luggage, bustling counselors, shyness, giggles, showingoff, and here and there an incipient case of homesickness.

title: Real Places
description: GREENWICH, CONN. THERE'S a world of conflict beneath the blanket of tranquillity that covers the woodsycountry house of Bill and Barbara Williams in what the local gentry call backcountry Greenwich. Beyond the perception of the uneducated eye, the house is surrounded by a struggle for survival that confounds the errant pavementpounder who has dropped in and divines only an almost disturbing serenity in the chirpy silence. It is peace that seems to preclude the street dramas perennially waiting to be played out on the sidewalks of New York.

title: Article 11 -- No Title
description: Article 11 -- No Title

title: Rules Modified On Feedgrains
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland said today that newcrop corn and sorghum would be allowed into the feedgrain reserves at harvest if the stockpile and Governmentowned stocks did not total 670 million bushels by Oct. I.

title: State Plan to Preserve Farmland Threatened By Dispute Over Costs
description: TRENTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  New Jersey's experimental project to save farmland from suburban sprawl has come to halt  and it is unclear what state officials will do to conserve dwindling agricultural land. me controversial $5 million pilot project in eastern Burlington County officially expired July 22, and Governor Byrne has not said whether he will sign bill to extend the program.

title: Obituary 8 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Pond Breaks Record, Wins Talladega 500
description: TALLADEGA, Ala. Aug. 7 (UPI) Lennie Pond held off a lastlap challenge by the defending champion, Donnie Allison, to record his first superspeedway victory yesterday at a recordshattering 174.700 miles an hour in the $217,000 Talladega 500.

title: The One That Got Away
description: Revenge is not the noblest of human motives, but it can be one of the sweetest. And, although Mike Torrez of the Boston Red Sox insists with a pearly smile that I'm not mad at anybody, there he is gleefully driving every nail he can into the New York Yankees coffin.

title: The Ritual Moves Begin
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Suddenly Presidential politics is bustin out all over:

title: Deaths
description: KARLSTE I NMax beloved father of Barbara, Ira, Kenneth. Dianne and Patricia. cherished grandfather of Deborah, David and Toby *voted brother of Jean, Lance and Betty. Lifelong friend of Aimee. Services Tuesday 1PM Kirschenbaum's, Coney Island Ave at Ave H, Bklyn.

title: Former.New York State Senator Fined $18,500 on Theft Charges
description: LOCKPORT, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)  Former State Senator Lloyd H. Paterson was placed on probation for five years and was fined $18,500 today on charges that he took money from Niagara County funds and from private estates when he was County Treasurer.

title: F.B.I. JOINS INQUIRY IN BRINK'S FILM CASE
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7  After a film producer received a $600,000 extortion demand, agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation joined the Boston police in the search for three gunmen who took 13 reels of film from the office of the Brink's Productions Film Company here on July 28, a Boston official disclosed today.

title: Maine Strike Worries Papers
description: As their supplies of newsprint grow tighter, newspapers in the Northeast are keeping an anxious eye on a strike against the Great Northern Paper Company, which yesterday entered its sixth week. The strike. against the subsidiary of the Great Northern Nekoosa Corporation, has closed the huge mill in northern Maine that produces about onequarter of all the newsprint used in New England. The surprise action was the first at the company inmore than 70 years.

title: Investment GroupSaid to. Buy Royal Manhattan Hotel
description: The Royal Manhattan Hotel, which has been closed since 1974, has been sold to an investment group that reportedly hopes to convert its 1,400 rooms to apaitments.. The purchase price is said to have been $2.5 million. beverai persons familiar with the transaction said that the investment group is headed by Paul Milstein, who recently paid close to $30 million for two operating midtown hotels, the Biltmore and the Roosevelt. Mr. Milstein could not be reached for comment.

title: Paper Supplies Dwindle In 27Mill Coast Strike
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7  In what appears to be the widest strike to hit the West Coast pulp and paper industry in 14 years, 27 mills have been closed, idling more than 27,000 workers from California to Alaska.

title: Books of The Times
description: TOISTOY wrote to N.N. Strakhov in 1883: It seems to me that you have been the victim of a false and erroneous attitude  not on your part but on everybody's part  toward Dostovevskv

title: The New York Times/lick Manniog
description: OFF TO CAMP: Youngsters waited at Salvation Army headquarters at West 14th Street yesterday for bus to take them off to summer camp with mixed feelings of anxiety and anticipation.

title: Associated Press
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 7  Prime Minister Pham Van Dong of Vietnam told an American delegation sent to Hanoi by Senator Edward M. Kennedy that his country wanted not only a reconciliation with the United States, but also normalization of relations and indeed friendship'between the two nations. ne delegation arrived here today after a week's stay in Vietnam. It brought out of the country 19 children and 10 wives who had been separated from their American fathers and husbands by the Communist victory in 1975. The 29 will be taken to the United States for the first VietnameseAmerican family reunification.

title: Rebel Traditionalists Plan Rite 1 For Longtime Foe, Pope Paul
description: PARIS, Aug. 7 (AP)  Parisian followers of Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre, the traditionalist who challenged Pope Paul VI's leadership and reforms in the Roman Catholic Church, plan to celebrate a Mass on Thursday for the Pope's soul.

title: PAUL VI IS PRAISED AROUND THE WORLD
description: Words of sorrow and praise for Pope Paul VI came from East and West yesterday, and the flags of many nations flew at half staff in mourning. The Pope, who died Sunday at the age of 80, was praised by religious and secular leaders, and memorial services were scheduled around the world. in Moscow, the Soviet party newspaper, Izvestia, said of the late Pontiff in dispatch from Rome:

title: Race in Jersey for US. Senate Seat Held Test of Conservative Strategy
description: The United States Senate campaign in New Jersey is taking shape as a test of the nationwide conservative strategy and ideology that may be used in the 1980 Presidential race.

title: Ballet: Balanchine Talks Of Creativity in Dance
description: THIS week, George Balanchine is accompanying the New York City Ballet to Copenhagen, where his company opens a sixday, engagement tonight at the Tivoli Gardens. Then he will go to Zurich to work with a new Swiss ballet company he has helped sponsor. And next winter, he says, I'm not going to do anything new.

title: Talks Intensify as Threatened Pressmen's Strike Nears
description: Negotiators for the pressmen's union and for the city's three major daily newspapers intensified their efforts yesterday to resolve their contract dispute over press manning and avert a strike threatened for today. The talks, which ended late last night, were scheduled to resume this morning.

title: A Writer With Steady Work Under Sadat's Aegis
description: CAIRO  Egypt's most influential literarypolitical personage today is Rashad Rushdy, a playwright, novelist and academician who spent several weeks in New York early this year at the offices of Harper & Row, writing and editing the recently published memoirs of his friend President Anwar elSadat.

title: Edward Duren Stone Services Will Be Held Tomorrow
description: Mr. Stone, the designer of such buildings as the John F. Kennedy Center in Washington and the General Motors Building in New York City, died at Roosevelt Hospital after a short illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Westchester Republicans Seek More Studies on Takeover of Con Ed
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 7  The Republican majority of the Westchester County Board of Legislators moved today to seek further studies of a proposed takeover of the Consolidated Edison Company's electricitydistribution facilities. The move was an effort to seize the initiative in the controversial issue from the County Executive, Alfred B. DelBello.

title: Assemblyman Backs Miss Krupsak For Her Pledge on Death Sentences
description: Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak has won the endorsement of Assemblyman Vincent J. Graber, a leading sponsor of the bill to restore the death penalty in New York State, because of Miss Krupsak's pledge not to commute all death sentences it capital punishment becomes state law.

title: WHITE HOUSE CURBS CRITICISM OF LABOR
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 The Carter Administration moved today to curb criticism of highcost labor contracts by Barry Bosworth, head of the Council on Wage and Price Stability. That action seems aimed at stemming the growing criticism of the President by union leaders, some of whom are openly talking of not supporting him in 1980.

title: HIGH GERMAN AIDE, AN EXNA21, RESIGNS
description: WEST BERLIN, Aug. 7  Hans Filbinger. the Christian Democratic state governor of BadenWurttemberg, announced his resignation today after his party urged him to step down in the face of mounting accusations linked to his past as a Nazi judge.

title: Connecticut Widening Inquiry Into Vitamin C Loss in Orange Juices
description: Findings of significant deterioration of Vitamin C in reconstituted frozen orange juice have prompted an inquiry by the Connecticut Department of Consumer Protection and raised the possibility of a dispute with the Florida citrus industry.

title: Hero Funerals Held for 4 Firemen, Last of 6 Killed at Brooklyn Blcae
description: Fireman William O'Connor rode Fire Engine 156 for the last time yesterday.

title: HOUSE BACKS FUNDS FOR ATOMIC CARRIER OPPOSED BY CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  The House of Representatives approved funds tonight for another nuclearpowered carrier, contrary to President Carter's wishes, as it worked toward passage of a $119.3 billion defense appropriations bill that was described as the largest money measure ever put before Congress.

title: Angry Meeting Between Carey And Leaders Delays 2d Session
description: ALBANY, Aug. 7  With no agreement in sight on budget appropriations for anticrime measures and amid angry partisan namecalling, the legislative leaders tonight called off a session of the Legislature that had been scheduled to begin tomorrow.

title: Holding Back on H.M.O.'s
description: Health maintenance organizations (H.M.O.'s) offer medical services for a fixed annual fee. They are cheaper than conventional, feeforservice care because, with their income predetermined, they have no incentive to order unnecessary treatment, tests or hospitalization. The Carter Administration has heartily enctorseci me concept as consistent with its national healthinsurance and costcontainment goals and has backed legislation sponsored by Senators Kennedy Massachusetts and Schweiker of Pennsylvania to increase the level of Federal support.

title: The New York Times /Jack Manning
description: WELCOMED VOLUNTEERS: Youngsters joined in yesterday to help their city. They gathered at 53d Street and ington Avenue to lend a hand with cleanup operations and received appreciative glances from passersby.

title: Portuguese Revolution: Tattered Slogans, A Threadbare Economy
description: LISBON, Aug. 6  Power to the People, Death to Fascists and The struggle must continue are just an arbitrary selection of the slogans and posters that still cover every inch of wall space along Lisbon's decaying shopping.

title: United Press International
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 7  A crowd of pilgrims and the curious filed past the body of Pope Paul VI this morning at the papal summer residence.

title: DR. DAVID GOLDSTEIN DEAD AT AGE OF 69
description: Dr. David H. Goldstein, former medical director of The New York Times and a pioneer in the development of industrial medicine, died, suddenly Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, as he was returning on a bus from a visit to Boston. He was removed from the Port Authority. Bus Terminal to St. Clare's Hospital.

title: Offer Weighed By Del Monte
description: The Del Monte Corporation's directors took a formal look yesterday at R.J. Reynolds Industries $450 million cash offer for their company and directed management to investigate the bid.

title: Boeing Net Up 37% To Record
description: The Boeing Company, the nation's largest builder of commercial aircraft, reported record earnings yesterday for the quarter ended June 30. The company, whose profit rose 37.4 percent in the second quarter from the yearearlier level, attributed the results to favorable performance on major aircraft programs and higher commercial jet transport production.

title: Market Place
description: HOW does a company increase its interest in a subsidiary without using cash? Ask City Investing. Until fairly recently City Investing, a conglomerate, owned 59 percent of GDV Inc., a real estate holding company that owns General Development, Florida's largest community builder. General Development survived a depression in real estate the early 1970's, emerging strong and with greatly appreciated land values and much enhanced receivables.

title: Malverne School Busing Ordered
description: The State Education Commissioner has ordered the Malverne School District on Long Island to immediately provide school transportation for about 900 children from a predominantly, black area, even though the district's taxpayers have rejected financing for busing on 10 occasions.

title: Adm. CharlesEdward La Haye, Fought With Free French Force
description: PARIS, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  Adm. CharlesEdward La Haye, a veteran of the Free French Forces in World War II. died yesterday at the age of 68, his family announced today.

title: Syracuse Suing to Ease Hiring Of Minorities in 2 Departments
description: UTICA, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)  Attorneys for the city of Syracuse filed a suit today in Federal District Court here challenging Onondaga County's Civil Service examination used in. hiring for that city's Police and Fire Departments.

title: Famous Trainer of Racing Horses. Charged in Death of East Side Man
description: Howard Jacobson, a Manhattan realestate and modelagency entrepreneur and one of the country's most successful and controversial trainers of thoroughbred racehorses in the 1960's, was charged yesterday with the murder of man whose charred body was found Sunday by firemen in a burning packing crate in a vacant lot in the Bronx.

title: PRESIDENT'S COUNSEL ASSAILS A.B.A. PLAN
description: An American Bar Association proposal for providing Government funds to defend indigent criminals was criticized yesterday by the counsel to President Carter as an attempt by lawyers to shirk their ethical oblieation.

title: For Once, a Yank Controversy Fizzles
description: With the change of managerial leadership from the troubled Billy Martin to the serene Bob Lemon, the turmoil that enveloped the New York Yankees was supposed to abate, and indeed it has. However, suspicion always is rampant and intrigue dies hard.

title: The Vatican Official in Temporary Charge
description: ROME, Aug. 7  Jean Cardinal Villot, the selfeffacing French prelate who will be administrative head of the Roman Catholic Church until the election of a new Pope, has for nine years been the secondranking man in theVatican, though more in name than in fact.

title: Hall of Fame Day: It's Baseball's Greatest
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y. Aug. 7 Under the same canopy of trees that has provided the ceiling for ceremonies for the last 38 years, Eddie Mathews, Larry MacPhail and Adrian (Addie) Joss were inducted today into Baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Article 9 -- No Title
description: UP FROM THE ASHES: Arehitect's rendering of new Wilson School,designed by George A. Diamond Associates, for which groundbreaking is scheduled tomorrow

title: Peru, I.M.F. Reach Credit Agreement
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 8  After more than 16 months of stormy and unsuccessful negotiations, Peru and the International Monetary Fund have reached an agreement aimed at saving the country from bankruptcy and the fund from accusations of insensitivity to economic and political problems of the third world.

title: Schedule Is Listed by the Vatican
description: ROME, Aug. 7 (AP)  The Vatican has announced the following schedule of events leading up to the conclave of cardinals to elect a successor to Pope Paul VI:

title: Notes on People
description: TENNIS has finally taken its toll, Senator Jacob K. Javits said yesterday, announcing that he will enter Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center today for surgery to repair a damaged nerve in his right elbow. The nerve has oeen punisneo by well over 50 years of tennis, said the 74yearold Senator. He said that he would be in the hospital's Harkness Pavilion for three days. Does all this mean Mr. Javits's tennisplaying days are over? No, my doctor promised I can be back on the courts in three weeks, he said.

title: Official Secrets
description: WASHINGTONWhen a jury in Alexandria, Va., brought in a guilty verdict against Ronald Humphrey and David Truong, accused of spying for for Vietnam, on May 19, the United States acquired, at least in the eyes of the Carter Adminstration Justice Department, an official secrets act. ine two men were convicted of espionage, conspiracy to commit espionage, conspiracy to commit an offense against the United States, stealing United States property, failing to register as agents and the unauthorized possession of documents relating to the national defense.

title: News Summary
description: The papal interregnum began formally as Jean Cardinal Villot, the secondranking prelate of the Roman Catholic Church, took possession of the Apostolic Palace of the Vatican and called meeting of the Sacred College of Cardinals to elect a new pope. The body of Pope Paul VI, who died Sunday, is to lie in state in St. Peter's Basilica Thursday and Friday and to be buried Saturday. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: BEIRUT STRIFE STIRS FEAR OF WIDER WAR
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 7  Every night now, defiant Christian militiamen here snipe away at Syrian peacekeeping troops, who respond with almost every weapon in their arsenal.

title: ExS.E.C. Aide Expects Pensioner to Lose Case
description: A former ranking staff member of the Securities and Exchange Commission predicted yesterday that the Supreme Court would reverse the controversial decision of a lower court that a 69yearold retired truck driver had been defrauded of pension benefits by his union's pension fund.

title: CARDINAL TAKES UP CONTROL OF CHURCH; FUNERAL SATURDAY
description: ROME, Aug. 7  The Regime of the Vacant See, the interregnum between the death of a pope and the election of his successor, started formally today as Jean Cardinal Villot, the secondranking prelate of the Roman Catholic Church, took possession of the Apostolic Palace of the Vatican.

title: AMER BILTRITE (A)
description: For periods as shown. (N) Ind!. cafes stock Is listed on the New York Stock E xchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Bailey Hints at New Revelations Should Miss Hearst Attack Him
description: SAN FRANCISCO (UPI)  Patricia Hearst's efforts to seek an overturning of her conviction on armed robbery charges on the ground that her defense was inept could lead to revelations that are even more damaging to her, F. Lee Bailey, the lawyer, said today.

title: Hero Funerals Held for 4 Firemen, Last of 6 Killed at Brooklyn Blaze
description: Fireman william O' connor rode Fire Engine 156 for the last time yesterday.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7  Paving the way for the proposed acquisition of the Marine Midland Banks, the Hongkong and Shanghai Bank has agreed to sell its six California banks to the Central Bank of Oakland for about $20 million.

title: Plainfied Program Aids Recovering Heart Patients
description: PLAINFIELD  A program designed to help people recovering from heart attacks to resume normal lives will begin a new session today at Muhlenberg Hospital here.

title: Music: Parody by Dennis Eberhard
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 7  Most parodies, like most poems, are lowlevel wit, easy to dismiss with an embarrassed laugh. But above and beyond the Mad magazine variety of lampoon there is a more serious kind of joking, which in its finest form can be devastating to its object because it is written from the inside of a tradition, with mingled disrespect and affection. That was the level to which Dennis Eberhard's Parody,''a work for soprano and chamber ensemble, seemed to be aspiring last night at Tanglewood.

title: Around the Nation
description: ELKINS, W. Va., Aug. 7 (AP) Federal judge ordered today that a contractor delay for five days plans to resume cleanup operations on a giant cooling tower at Willow Island, W. Va., where 51 construction workers fell to their deaths April 27.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 7 (Reuters) Nationalist guerrillas wounded six blacks last night in a bombing attack in a township near Salisbury, the police said today.

title: TV Set Views Viewer
description: GEORGE ORWELL'S prophecy of an advanced electronic society in 1989, in which the television set may watch as well as be watched, could be fulfilled right on schedule in the next five or six gears, a substantial part of the country may be served by form of twoway cable television that is linked to a set of computers.

title: Noted Racehorse Trainer Charged With the Murder of East Side Man
description: Howard Jacobson, a Manhattan realestate and modelagency entrepreneur and one of the country's most successful and controversial trainers of thoroughbred racehorses in the 1960's, was charged yesterday with the murder of man whose charred body was found Sunday by firemen in a burning packing crate in a vacant lot in the Bronx.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Arthur Spear, a key executive at Mattel Inc. since company founders Elliot and Ruth Handler departed in the wake of a financial scandal, has been named chairman, a post that had been vacant. He continues as chief operating officer.

title: Obituary 6 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Vance Starts Crucial Talks in Egypt
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug. 7 Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance opened decisive round of talks with President Anwar elSadat tonight in an effort to persuade the Egyptian leader not to lose patience on negotiations with Israel for settlement in the Middle East.

title: Carter Approves Emergency Help In Niagara Area
description: President Carter approved Federal emergency financial aid last night for the Love Canal area of Niagara Falls, N.Y., where chemical leakage from an old landfill has endangered the health of residents whose backyards border the site.

title: County Government Employees In Westchester Must Live There
description: WHITE. PLAINS, Aug. 7  New employees of Westchester's county government, with a few exceptions, will be required  under a law that became effective today  to be residents of the county for at least 30 days before their appointment and to continue to live in the county while they hold their jobs. ine iaw DeCaMe eliective when the Board of Legislators voted 12 to 5 to override a veto by County Executive Alfred B. DelBello. Three Democrats joined nine Republicans in supporting the motion to override while one Republican and four Democrats voted to sustain the veto. Twelve votes were required to override.

title: Israeli Official Says U.S. Curbed Steps to Aid Lebanese Christians
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 7  The chairman of the Israeli Parliament's Foreign Affairs and Security Committee said in a message to two leading members of the United States Congress today that the United States Government had restrained Israel from moves to save Christians in Lebanon from massacre.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Beatrice Foods and Tropicana merged just minutes after a Federal Appeals Court delay of the merger expired. Beatrice will pay Tropicana stockholders some $488 million in cash and stock. But the Federal Trade Commission, which considers the merger anticompetitive, intends to continue its opposition. [Page D1.1

title: Mondale Asserts Affirmative Action Programs Are Blocked by Congress
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7  Vice President Mondale said today that the Carter Administration remained committed to affirmative action and social progress for minorities but that it had been stymied in its efforts by an inactive Congress.

title: 2 New Comedians Joke Their Way Up
description: M ONTEITH AND RAND may call to mind some bluechip investment firm. But not for long. Critics and columnists have been purring with delight over John Monteith and Suzanne Rand. The two comemans, tooth in their late 20's, have been called madcap and brilliant, the new Nichols and May. There are lines at the box office of the Theater East.

title: Favored Affirmed All Set For a Jim Dandy Tuneup
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 7  It's only a $35,000 race on a Tuesday, the slowest day of the week, but reserved seats for tomorrow's card at Saratoga have been sold out. The reason: Affirmed will be going to the post for the first time since he completed his sweep of the triple crown two months ago.

title: Westport Youth, 18, Indicted
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 7 (AP) A grand jury today returned a murder indictment against 18yearold Edward Falby of Westport in the slaying of 9 yearold Karl Jo Spurkeland, whose body was found near her Westport home June 13. Mr. Falby, being held under a $200,000 bond, is scheduled to enter a plea Aug. 21. An autopsy report said the girl had died of smothering or suffocation and had been sexually assaulted.

title: Britain and U.S. Consider Plans for Rhodesian Rescue
description: LONDON, Aug. 7  The British and American Governments have begun separate, lowlevel studies of a variety of plans to rescue white and black Rhodeslaw who might be trapped if order there should collapse.

title: Last Chance Act for the City
description: George Washington said goodbye to his officers Fraunces Tavern; President Carter will go to the City Hall steps, a few blocks uptown, to usher in a Federal guarantee for New York City bonds. His signing of the new law, on General Washington's desk, attests to the efforts of his Administration to save New York City from bankruptcy.

title: Thomson Base Moving From Britain to Canada
description: LONDON, Aug. 7  The wealthy Thomson empire, which owns The Times of London among scores of other things, plans to move its operating base from Britain to Canada, which would allow greater opportunities to invest its profits from North Sea oil.

title: Laboratory Says Paraquat Tests Were Inaccurate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7 The director of the StreetDrug Analysis Laboratory, which first sounded the alarm last March on herbicide contamination of marijuana, said today that the test his organization had used to identify the herbicide paraquat was inaccurate.

title: Favored Affirmed All Set For a Jim Dandy Tuneup
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 7  It's only a $35,000 race on a Tuesday, the slowest day of the week, but reserved seats for tomorrow's card at Saratoga have been sold out. The reason: Affirmed will be going to the post for the first time since he completed his sweep of the triple crown two months ago.

title: Washington Journal
description: CARMALA WALLGREN is a teacher and a law student, an ardent advocate for the equal rights amendment, a thoroughly accomplished 31yearold who also happens to be married to a United States Congressman. She definitely does not fit the popular image of the political wife doll: Wind her up and she smiles bravely and says thank you.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: limps

title: Honduran Military Says Head of State Resigns
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Tuesday, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The head of state of Honduras. Brig. Gen. Juan Alberto Melgar Castro, resigned tonight and was replaced by a threeman military junta, the Superior Council of the Armed Forces announced.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A young man was shot dead by a police officer in Jamaica, Queens. The police said the man had been advancing on the officer and wielding two pieces of pipe.

title: Pop: 4 Groups Contend With Drizzle in Jersey
description: AROUND 51,000 fans, most of them very wet, cheered goodnaturedly through a soggy afternoon of hard rock at Giants Stadium in the New Jersey Meadowlands on Sunday. Journey, the second or iour groups to play  1rank Marino and Mahogany Rush went a halfhour before the scheduled noon starting time and the reviewer missed them  managed to drive the clouds away temporarily with a bright, tightly focused and versatile set, but Ted Nugent played through a steady drizzle, and Aerosmith, after a few rainless minutes, ended its performance in a downpour.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: Court Upholds Artist's Heirs
description: The Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court yesterday upheld an earlier ruling that 300 canvasses by Arnold Friedman, the artist who died in 1946 at the age of 74, belonged to his estate and not to Charles Egan, an art dealer.

title: Braves Beat Reds and Seaver, 53
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 7 (AP)  Mickey Mahler. and Gene Garber held Cincinnati to six hits, and Rod Gilbreath drove in two runs tonight as the Atlanta Braves scored a 53 victory over the Reds and handed Tom Seaver his seventh loss in nine outings since his nohitter June 16. The defeat also knocked the Reds out of first place in National League West.

title: Vance Starts Crucial Talks in Egypt
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug. 7  Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance opened decisive round of talks with President Anwar elSadat tonight in an effort to persuade the Egyptian leader not to lose patience on negotiations with Israel for a settlement in the Middle East.

title: A Bomb Is Set Off in Puerto Rico Near Cuban Ballet Performance
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Aug. 7 (UPI)  An explosive device went off last night outside the auditorium where the Cuban National Ballet was performing, but there were no injuries or damage and the show went on.

title: California Reporter Wins Stay of Order jailing Him
description: SACRAMENTO, Aug. 7  A California appeals court has granted an indefinite stay of a contempt order against a Sacramento reporter who was ordered to surrender tapes and notes of conversations with a key witness in a murder case.

title: Strikers Released in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 8 (AP) Provincial authorities today released 33 journalists, trade union workers and students who had been held after staging a hunger strike at the Karachi Press Club during the last two weeks. During the hunger strike, the journalists demands included reinstatement of 30 journalists arrested during an April hunger strike and withdrawal of laws restricting press freedom.

title: Events
description: NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC IN THE PARKS, Central Park sheep IMacbw.8: 30.

title: Deaths
description: MURPHYMichael L., Captain, U.S Merchant Marine, on August 5, 1978. beloved son of Anna (nee Terrace) and the late Lawrence. Dear brother of Constance Gridley, Alice Patter son, Lawrence and Robert. Funeral Wednesday, 9 AM, from the McLaughlin 8. Sons Funeral Home, 822! Third Avenue, Brooklyn. Mass of the Resurrection, 9:30 AM, St. Anselm't Church.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Munford Inc., an Atlantabased convenience food store and dairyprocessing company, has elected Herbert J. Dickson to vice chairman, and Robert D. Blythe to president.

title: Reporter's Notebook: How East Germans. View Russians
description: NEUBRANDENBURG, East Germany  D.S.F. Strasse. Every little East German town seems to have one. and driving north from Berlin to Rostock, they become as much a part of the landscape as the quiet streets and the red banners damning the neutron bomb.

title: Firestone Reportedly Will Propose Recall of Tires
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Senior management executives of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company and their attorneys are hammering out a compromise proposal under which many of its controversial Firestone 500 steelbelted radial tires would be voluntarily recalled, it was learned today.

title: A NonItalian Pope?
description: WASHINGTONAs the Roman Catholic Church moves toward the selection of a successor for Pope Paul VI, at a'time when it needs a man of his caliber, it faces a dilemma.

title: GREEN BROOK AIDES PUSH FOR FLOOD AID
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, Aug. 7 Five years after a flood killed six persons and caused $26 million in property damage, officials in the Green Brook subbasin of the Raritan River fear public apathy as they near a critical point in efforts to gain support for a proposed $120 million floodcontrol nrniper.

title: William Winterbotham Woodside; Carnegie Museum Executive, 73
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7  William Winterbotham Woodside, retired business manager of the Carnegie Museum of Natural History, died yesterday at his home here. He was 73 years old.

title: Falcons Overcome a Deficit of 1 70
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. Aug. 7 Perhaps, Garry Ruetz suggested after the game was over, our record should only be 0 and .

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: Draths

title: HELEN OGSBURY BROOKS
description: Helen Ogsbury Brooks, retired bursar and assistant secretarytreasurer of Finch College in New York, died Sunday in a nursing home in Newtown, Conn. She was 79 years old and lived in Heritage Village in Southbury, Conn. Mrs. Brooks was graduated from Wellesley College and earned a master of arts degree at Columbia University.

title: Article 6 -- No Title
description: BOOK SALE AT THE LIBRARY: More than 7,000 books went on sale yesterday outside headquarters of the Monmouth County Library headquarters on Broad Street in Freehold. Composed of donations from residents and librarysystem duplicates, the books were priced from 10 cents to 75 cents, and attracted a sizable crowd of young and old. Sale continues all week, with the proceeds going to help the libiary.

title: Business Records
description: RICHARD MEACHAM, 2021E Richman Plaza, the Bronx. Liabilities, S17,016; assets, $5.34:

title: Interco Sets. Accord for Fingerhut
description: Interco Inc., the nation's largest shoe company, said in St. Louis yesterday that it had reached a tentative agreement to buy the Fingerhut Corporation of Minneapolis, a directmail company, for about $110 million in cash and stock.

title: Education Board to Reverse ClosedMeeting Policy
description: New York City's Board of Eduction, in a reversal of policy, has agreed to its briefing sessions to the public. had been held behind closed doors, contra rulry to state law and two major judicial ings.

title: Korea's Deficit Up With Japan
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 7South Korea's trade deficit with Japan surged to $1.5 billion in the first half of this year, leading Government officials and business executives to express serious concern over the widening trade gap.

title: Rumanian President Discusses Foreign Affairs With Brezhnev
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania, who will play host later this month to Hua Kuofeng, China's Communist Party Chairman, had talks today with the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev. ass, tne Soviet press agency, said the meeting, at Mr. Brezhnev's summer house in the Crimea, had dealt with bilateral issues and foreign policy matters, including dtente and disarmament.

title: Extradition Hearing Is Scheduled For 2 Move Members in Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 7 (AP)  A Sept. 5 extradition hearing was set today for two members of the Philadelphiabased group calling itself Move who were arrested in a local house and charged with being fugitives from Philadelphia.

title: Television
description: 6: 00 (4)Options for Older Adults (13)Captioned ABC News (R)

title: Death Toll Falls in Quebec Crash
description: WATERLOO, Quebec, Aug. 7 (AP) The death toll in the Lac d'Argent bus crash disaster of Friday night was revised down today to 40. The police originally believed 41 handicapped persons on their way home from a theatrical outing were killed when the bus's brakes tailed and it plunged into the lake. That estimate was based on 48 passengers; the police have determined that only 47 people were a boa rd.

title: Browns Bow, 217 Archer Sidelined
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 7  The Giants, after learning that a second starter, Troy Archer, would miss at least the, first two National Football League regularseason games, won their preseason opener tonight against the Cleveland Browns. 217.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WKCR. Fantasias for Viols; The Indian Queen, Purcell. 78, WNCN. Lachrimae; Two Galliards, Dowland; Scipio Overture, Handel; Turkish March, Mozart; Sonata for Trumpet and Organ. Fantini.

title: Japan Trade: U.S. Gloomy
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  Frank Weil, the United States Assistant Secre tary of Commerce, warned today against expecting rapid elimination of Japan's huge trade surplus with the United States  which soared to $6.6 billion in the first half of this year, almost double the yearearlier figure.

title: Vilas Wins Final, 61, 63, In RainPlagued Tennis
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 7 Guillermo Vilas defeated JoseLuis Clerc, his countryman, in the singles final of the $75,000 Grand Prix tennis championships here today as players rushed to finish before rains washed the court and crowd away. vitas overcame Clerc, a 19yearold Argentine, 61, 63.

title: News Summary
description: The papal interregnum began formally as Jean Cardinal Villot, the secondranking prelate of the Roman Catholic Church, took possession of the Apostolic Palace of the Vatican and called a meeting of the Sacred College of Cardinals to elect a new pope. The body of Pope Paul VI, who died Sunday, is to lie in state in St. Peter's Basilica Thursday and Friday and to be buried Saturday. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: CARDINAL TAKES UP CONTROL OF CHURCH; FUNERAL SATURDAY
description: ROME, Aug. 7  The Regime of the Vacant.See, the interregnum between the death of a pope and the election of his successor, started formally today as Jean Cardinal Villot, the secondranking prelate of the Roman Catholic Church, took possession of the Apostolic Palace of the Vatican.

title: Last 2 of 5 City Beaches That Were Closed by Oil Spill Are Reopened
description: Jacob Riis Beach Park and Breezy Point beach were reopened yesterday, the last of five city bathing spots to reopen after being closed because of oil that had spilled from a sunken barge off RockaWay Point on July 31.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MISSION VIEJO, Calif., Aug. 7 (AP)  Greg Louganis and Melissa Briley won 10meter national titles at the Amateur Athletic Union outdoor diving championships yesterday and qualified for the United States team for the World Aquatic Games in West Berlin.

title: When the King Does Do Wrong
description: America began life amid denunciations of King George as a tyrant, but it has clung, ever since, to the doctrine of sovereign immunity  the King can do no wrong. In its extreme form, this doctrine immunizes government against suits to redress even the most outrageous violations of citizens rights.
