The idea is that even democratic governments must be free to do the public business without being subject to harassing lawsuns. bo government can be sued only when it agrees be sued, which is not often. The problem is one of balance: how to deter, remedy and punish wrongdoing without inhibiting the process of government.

title: 3,500 Mourn Death of Pope During Mass at St. Patrick's.
description: Lord have mercy echoed through St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday as 3,500 New Yorkers crowded into a noontime memorial mass for Pope Paul VI, who died on Sunday.

title: Races Canceled At Monmouth
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., Aug. 7 Jockeys at Monmouth Park today refused to ridelor the second time at the meeting, citing unsafe track conditions.

title: Bets on the New Pope Assailed in Parliament
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (AP)  Simon Mahon, a Roman Catholic member of Parliament, complained today that Ladbroke's, a British bookmaking firm, is taking bets on who will succeed Pope Paul VI.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets, after a heated twoweek rally, cooled off yesterday, while bond prices continued to gain in quiet trading. The advance, however, was moderate.

title: Monticello Track to Reopen; Horsemen's Dispute Settled
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP) Monticello Raceway will reopen tomorrow after a labor dispute that had kept the track dark for a week was resolved today.

title: Blazers Offer Fans a Refund
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 7 (AP)  The Portland Trail Blazers offered refunds today to seasonticket holders disappointed by Bill Walton's announced plans to leave the National Basketball Association team. Meanwhile, the New York Knicks and Golden State Warriors were next in line for talks aimed at landing the 6foot11 center.

title: Moynihan Sees Need For Bill to Guarantee Freedom of the Press
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  Deploring the jailing of M. A. Farber, a New York Times reporter, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan said today that Congress might have to act to assure continued freedom of the press.

title: WHITE HOUSE CURBS CRITICISM OF LABOR
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7  The Carter Administration moved today to curb criticism of highcost labor contracts by Barry Bosworth, head of the Council on Wage and Price Stability. That action seems aimed at stemming the growing criticism of the President by union leaders, some of whom are openly talking of not supporting him in 1980.

title: NBC Wins a Round With Ruling Over Incitement to Sex Attack
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Aug. 7  The judge in the Born Innocent trial ruled today that in order to collect damages from the National Broadcasting Company the plaintiff must actually prove that the network intended viewers to imitate the violent rape scene in the television movie. he ruling was a decisive First Amendment victory for NBC and raised the strong probability that the case will be dismissed tomorrow, with the agreement of both sides, to give the plaintiff a chance to seek an appellate court review of the judge's order.

title: Reserve Bank Economist Reports Gains in New York City's Economy
description: After nearly a decade of contraction and decline, the it York City economy turned upward inthe past year, showing mime dramatic improvement in such sectors as the commercial rental market, an economist with the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. isut tne economist. Rona IL Stein, cautioned in the bank's Quarterly Review that the durability of the turnamund is by no means assured. A slowdown in the national economic expansion threatens the citys limited recovery,as does the city governments continuing fiscal crisis.

title: Recipients To Ford Will
description: The will of the late Benson Ford, vice president and director of the Ford Motor Company and a brother of Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the company, names his widow, Edith McNaughton Ford, as recipient of his real estate, cars, jewelry, art works and half of his total estate.

title: MOVE TO END FUNDS FOR ATOMIC CARRIER REJECTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  The House of Representatives refused tonight to delete funds for another nuclearpowered carrier as it worked toward passage of a $119.3 billion defense appropriations bill that was described as the largest money measure ever put before Congress.

title: VISTA's Chief: An Old New Leftist Settles Down
description: WASHINGTON  She has been called the Axis Sally of Vietnam by syndicated columnist, arrested five times as an antiwar demonstrator, and termed a radical leftist by members of Congress. But 30yearold Margery Tabankin  plump, brighteyed and eager  looks and talks more like the homespun creature she says she really is.

title: AssOCIaled
description: SUMMER FLOODING: Heavy rains which have struck portions of the East Coast in last four days have begun to cause flooding. In Providence, R.I., where four inches of rain fell, motorists yesterday tried to push car to higher ground.

title: TV: E.R.A. Documentary
description: AN effective halfhour documentary, E.R A : A Family. Matter, puts the efforts in behalf of the equalrights amendment on a personal basis on WNETTV at 10:30 tonight.

title: Deaths
description: SNYDERSamuel,devoted lather of Dr. Aaron, Ms Georgine Handman, Ms Rita Glickman. Loving grandfather of Arnold and Fern Handman, Barry Mark,Ross Glickman.Cherished grandfather Frank Jr. and Joseph Gervasi. Services Tuesday. 1:30PM The Riverside Ocean Pkwy & Prospect Pk.

title: MiniTrial to Settle Lawsuit
description: With expensive, timeconsuming litigation posing growing problem for businessmen, alternatives to fullscale court battles  fights that involve thousands pages of documents and platoons of highpriced lawyers  are being explored.

title: U.S. Motorcyclist Wins
description: SILVERSTONE, England, Aug. 7 (AP)  Kenny Roberts of the United States was confirmed late yesterday as the winner of the British 500cc Motorcycle Grand Prix. The race was interrupted when heavy rain led some riders to stop to change to wetweather tires. When they got back to the track, officials did not know their positions. After Roberts was originally declared the winner, Britain's defending world champion, Barry Sheene, protested, as did other riders.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The beleaguered dollar fell against most currencies in world foreignexchange trading yesterday, making particularly weak showing against the powerful West German mark, although it did show gains against the yen.

title: Cosmos Turn Attention To Sounders in Playoffs
description: HEMPSTEAD, Li., Aug. 7  Knowing that even the team with the best record in the North American Soccer League could be eliminated in one game in the opening round of the playoffs, the Cosmos trained hard here today in preparation for their playoff opener against the Seattle Sounders at Giants Stadium Wednesday night.

title: Associated Press
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 7  Prime Minister Pham Van Dong of Vietnam told an American delegation sent to Hanoi by Senator Edward M. Kennedy that his country wanted not only a reconciliation with the United States, but also normalization of relations and indeed friendship"between the two nations.

title: AMERICAN ANGLICANS SEEK BOLDER PARLEY
description: CANTERBURY, England, Aug. 6 A revolt by bishops from North America has resulted in a revised schedule at the Lambeth World Conference of the Anglican hierarchy that is intended to increase open debate on key issues. The move. led by Americans and Canadians, is an effort to reduce control over the conference program by the planning committee and to encourage the bishops to confront controversial resolutions.

title: Economic Scene
description: IN the halcyon 1960's, when highflying conglomerates thought they had unlocked the secrets of synergism  the managerial art of making two plus two equal five  LTV bought Jones & Laughlin, the seventh largest American steel producer, and Lykes acquired Youngstown Sheet and Tube, the eighth largest steel producer.

title: California Reporter Wins Jail Stay
description: SACRAMENTO, Aug. 7, A California appeals court has granted an indefinite stay of a contempt order against a Sacramento reporter who was ordered to surrender tapes and notes of conversations with a key witness in a murder case.

title: Trenton Topics Teacher Suit Fights Evaluation Guidelines
description: TRENTON Aug. 7 The New Jersey Education Association and seven affiliates filed suit in Federal Distric Court here today seeking to halt the implementation of new guidelines on teacher evaluation adopted by the State Board of Education.

title: Text of the Statement By Pope Paul's Doctor
description: ROME, Aug. 7  Following, in unofficial translation from the Italian, is the death certificate of Pope Paul VI issued by his personal physician.

title: Storm Ahead on TV Ads for Children
description: Although it has been under a constant barrage of criticism for years, television advertising aimed at children has generally managed to stay out of the political arena. But no more. Two reuerai regulatory agencies are zeroing in on such ads, and the gathering storm is likely to have wide implications for the television industry, advertisers and perhaps even the regulatory process itself. The. Federal inquiries could lead to severe restrictions on TV advertising to children and, conceivably, even to an outright ban.

title: Rough Days Are Here For Hayfever Victims
description: Climate conditions earlier this year. indicate that this month and early September will be an unusually rough period for hayfever sufferers in New Jersey, according to researchers at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston and Middlesex General Hospital in New Brunswick.

title: Sears to Cut New York Buying Unit
description: In a move that will dramatically curtail operations of the largest merchandising staff in New York City run by an outoftown company, Sears, Roebuck & Company announced plans yesterday to move its women's apparel and accessories buying departments to its headquarters in Chicano.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Air Travel Boom Makes Agents Fume
description: The proliferation of cutrate air fares that has set off a boom in air travel and raised airline revenues  ironically has brought grief to the nation's travel agents.

title: As Rain Aids Attendance, Law Parley Weighs Both the Frivolous And the Serious
description: At the American Bar Association convention, which will end here on Wednesday, hundreds meetings are held, ranging from the vaguely frivolous to the practical to the serious: Attendance these sessions in the last few days seems to have paralleled the intensity of the rain outside.

title: Thrift Accounts Survey
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The average person with an account at a savings and loan institution had a balance of $5,021 at the end of last year, a trade association said today. The United States League of Savings Associations said the balance included interest payments averaging $300. There were about 77 million savings and loan accounts with $387 billion in deposits at the end of the year, the organization said. That was an increase of about 13 percent in deposits from the end of 1976.

title: Bridge:
description: Few players have any particular reason to remember their first duplicate game, but Jill Slater of Staten Island will surely be among that number. She was a winner at a Tuesday afternoon game at Snug Harbor, the setting for Staten Island's first tournament next October, and it was the first time she had played any kind of bridge without an experienced adviser at her elbow. She is only 9 years old.

title: The New York Time/Track Managing
description: OFF TO CAMP: Youngsters waited at Salvation Army headquarters at 132 West 14th Street yesterday for bus to take them off to summer camp with mixed feelings of anxiety and anticipation.

title: Walter B. Smith 2d Weds Miss Pearson
description: Nancy Clark Pearson of Baltimore was married in Newport, R.I., yesterday to Walter Burges Smith 2d, a Foreign Service officer of Washington and Narragansett, R.I. The Rev. B. Lorne Coyle performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: 2 Transportation Programs Waste $29 Million a Year, Report Asserts
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 The State Department of Transportation is wasting $29 million a year of its annual budget of $144 million, according to excerpts from study released today by former Senator Alene S. Ammond, who was chairman of the commission that conducted the study.

title: G.M. Shifts Top Officers As Vice Chairman Quits
description: Richard L. Terrell, vice chairman of the General Motors Corporation and Jong a prime contender for its presidency, resigned yesterday, citing personal and health reasons.

title: Shenefield Cites Peril
description: A top Federal Government antitrust official said yesterday that continued Government regulation in the energy industries could result in at least as much harm as anticompetitive behavior by business itself.

title: New York Survey Lists Industries Poisons
description: As the storm over the dumping of chemical wastes in the Love Canal section of Niagara Falls continued to unfold, New York State's Department of Environmental Conservation yesterday released a list of scores of industries that use toxic chemicals.

title: Airline Sound and Fury
description: A few months ago it appeared that the quid pro quo for airline deregulation legislation would be Federal money to help the airlines meet new aircraft noise standards. Only by supporting noise control subsidies could the Administration muster the votes in the House to open air routes to new competitors and allow carriers to set their own fares. Congressional ardor for noise control funds has, however, cooled somewhat with ITports of fat airline profits, and the deregulation effort is now apparently strong enough to stand on its own.

title: Capital's Menus: Testing for the Truth
description: WASHINGTON When Joseph Nuzzi arrived at a restaurant in one of the prominent hotels here, thestaff snapped into action. Mr. Nuzzi was escorted through the line of patrons waiting for lunch and someone scurried off to find the manager. Seconds later, the manager appeared, affable and solicitous.

title: Real Estate
description: ALMOST a decade ago the Hilton Hotels Corporation planned to expand the New York Hilton, making it the world's largest hotel. However, the plan to extend the hotel westward toward Seventh Avenue along 53d Street and to add 1,250 rooms to the 2,153room hotel  so that it would surpass the 3,128room Rossiya Hotel in Moscow  collided with the city's fiscal crisis and the prolonged debate over a new convention center that clouded the changing hotel market here.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The House Select Committee on Assaasinations today was temporarily denied $790,000 in additional funds until it answers questions about allegations that it taped telephone calls and used illegal techniques in its investigation of the murder of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: For a Success Story, Here's to Beer!
description: FOR those who get nostalgic about beer, there is a beloved time in the foamrich past when American beer was a hearty drink imbibed mostly in congenial taverns and the nation was awash in a wonderful multiplicity of different labels and brands.

title: Pop: Cars Merge Styles
description: THE Cars, who are at the Bottom Line through tonight, are special. One suspects that they could become a very popular rock band, for they have taken some important but disparate contemporary trends  punk minimalism, the labyrinthine synthesizer and guitar textures of art rock, the 50's rockabilly revival and the melodious terseness of power pop  and mixed them into personal and annealing blend.

title: New York Survey Lists Industries Poisons
description: As the storm over the dumping of chemical wastes in the Love Canal section of Niagara Falls continued to unfold, New York State's Department of Environmental Conservation yesterday released a list of scores of industries that use toxic chemicals.

title: National Air Gets Setback
description: A Florida circuit court refused yesterday to hear a suit brought by the state comptroller that would have prevented Texas International Airlines from acquiring more stock of National Airlines. But the Miamibased carrier continued to press its case against takeover with two Federal regulatory agencies.

title: Tomato Crop Is Suffering Damage From Rains at Peak Harvest Time
description: New Jersey's valuable tomato crop has suffered damage because of this month's frequent rainfall, and agricultural experts said yesterday that they were Worried that growers could face severe problems unless a period of drying weather sets in.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: John T. Landry was named senior vice presidentdirector of marketing of Philip Morris Inc. yesterday. He headed a list of four senior executives and 12 others promoted in a major executive realignment, effective Nov. 1. Mr. Landry is now executive vice president and director of marketing of Philip Morris U.S.A.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Decolonization Committee  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT is now more than eight years since John O'Hara died, and though it is still not outlandish to surmise that he may one day be the writer people read to learn what life in America was like during the first half of the 20th century, his own prediction of an O'Hara boom has not yet come to pass, at least so far as I'm aware. (I think I know my place in Am. Lit. as of five or 10 years after cool, but I would love to enjoy some of now, while I am alive, he wrote to friend in 1960.)

title: The President's Push for Peace
description: When in trouble, call in the President. That is the significance of next month's Middle East summit at Camp David. Anwar Sadat's public disappointment with the rigidities of Israeli diplomacy have made it politically impossible for him to meet Menachem Begin again without the leavening presence of Jimmy Carter. It is very much to the President's credit that he is willing so directly to tie his own prestige to the continuation of the peacemaking process.

title: Prostitutes Union Office Burns
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8 (AP) fivealarm warehouse fire on a 1,200foot pier destroyed the offices of the prostitutes union, COYOTE, yesterday and ruined or damaged some two dozen small businesses.

title: Bridge:
description: The Summer Nationals of the American Bridge Association in Chicago this week, like the corresponding tournament of the bigger American Contract Bridge League last month in Toronto, are breaking all attendance records. one of tnese recoras was set in the mixed pairs, played Sundy and won by Virginia Clarke and Otto Beatty of Columbus, Ohio.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FRONT AND CENTER A 70girl team of batontwirlers should be a picturesque sight for pedestrians and workers today in Rockefeller Center, especially because the performers will all be on roller skates. The energetic group are the Marinettes de Fecamp, from France, and their halfhour of acrobatic teamwork starting at 12:30 P.M. marks their only local appearance, following a stint in Milwaukee at the National Baton Twirling Exhibition.

title: Talks at Camp David Will Seek to Break Mideast Stalemate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The White House announced today that President Carter would meet Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt on Sept. 5 to discuss ways of breaking the Middle East deadlock. The meeting will be at Camp David, the Presidential retreat in the Maryland mountains.

title: For the Best Corn, Freshness Is The Key
description: CORN on the cob, the grain that is usually considered the'most. American of vegetables, is just, beginning to come into markets from local farms. It is Doss'. ble, of course, to buy corn the year round, with pallid, tough and starchy Mexican varieties imported all winter. These are followed by the products of California,. Texas, Florida, and the Carolinas and, most recently, Virginia.

title: The New York Times/Carl T. Gossett
description: FARM PALS AT THE FAIR: Kelly Meyers, 19, of East Brunswick comforting Dusty, er Charolais steer, at exhibhin the Middlesex County Fair.

title: Lettin in the Commies
description: PARIS  It is not surprising that the recent show trials in the Soviet Union have stimulated Congress to look for appropriate responses. But those responses should be chosen with care.

title: POSSIBILITY OF LINK IN 2 DEATHS STUDIED
description: At 2:30 last Sunday morning, a 20yearold fashion model and a male friend plunged 17 stories from his apartment balcony on Manhattan's East Side when metal railing gave way. The woman died.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY. August 9

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: A major overhaul of Federal regulations and an easing of direct Government intervention in the economy were called for in a special report issued by the American Bar Association's Commission on Law and the Economy. It recommended the deregulation of such industries as airlines and the gradual phasing out of price controls on and natural gas. At the same time, John H. Shenefield, chief of the Justice Department's antitrust division, said there was a serious possibility that public restraints through regulation would pose longrun threats to competition and consumer interests. [Page D1.]

title: Mrs. Harris Skips a New Chance To Offer. View on Interest Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug:8 (UPI)  Patricia Roberts Harris, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, today passed up a chance to explain her view of interest rates, an opinion that prompted cancellation of her Congressional appearance yesterday.

title: Pop: Jukes Without Jive
description: DEVELOPING a rock style usually has more to do with effecting a synthesis than with ,creating a language. Even the earliest rockandroll was a synthesis of country and blues, and although the music has not lacked creative figures who effected bold, original changes, for the most part it has progressed a step at a time, building on wbet came before. Sometimes, especial& in, periods like this one; when innovation is at a premium, an artist will forge a style out of elements that have been neglected for a while, elements that belong to earlier strata of the rock tradition. If the elements are combined seamlessly enough and with enough personality and flair, the resulting style will be just as new and just as valid as styles created out of more contemporary components.

title: U.S. Launches Second Probe Toward Venus
description: The second of two American spacecraft boimd for Venus this year was launched yesterday on a fourmonth voyage to probe the hot, dense atmosphere of the Earth's nearest planetary neiehbor.

title: Market Place
description: DOES heavy trading volume increase or reduce the price stability of a stock? Conventional wisdom holds that on days that a stock trades heavily, its price pattern is likely to be less stable. nowever, it can De argued that as volume passes some critical level, the auction market gives way specialized institutional trading techniques, such as crosses, in which one broker acts for both buyer and seller. It may be that such techniques act to improve price stability under such circumstances.

title: PROPOSALS BY A.B.A. ON INMATES SCORED
description: Standards relating to the legal status of prisoners that have been proposed by the American Bar Association were attacked, yesterday by the president of the American Correctional Association as unrealistic and out of touch with the real world of standards.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, AUG. 8, 1978

title: Officer Killed as Philadelphia Radicals Are Evicted
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8  A policeman was shot to death and 18 other persons, 12 of them policemen and firemen, were injured here this morning as law enforcement officers stormed a barricaded house of selfstyled revolutionaries with bulldozer, fire hoses and tear gas.

title: Firestone, at Hearing, Asserts Its Radials Are Safe
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Representatives of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company argued here today that the controversial Firestone 500 steelbelted radial tire was a safe tire despite public feelings to the contrary.

title: Tender. AcCeptance Delayed For Some Fibreboard Shares
description: Effective June 27, Louisiana Pacific Corporation was to pay $17 a share for all the stock of Fibreboard Corporation under a merger agreement, but some shareholders of the latter company are still waiting. What appears to be holding things up for some Fibreboard owners is failure to execute the necessary letter or transmissal.

title: Par time Jobs Help Keep Europeans Down on the Farms
description: ST. THURIEN, France, Aug. 4  JeanPierre Philippe's two brothers and his sister moved to the city from the Normandy. countryside years ago, conceding the hopelessness of eking out a living from a small hereditary plot.

title: Miss Onassis Now Called Unsure On Rejoining Husband in Soviet
description: ATHENS, Aug. 8  Christina Onassis, sequestered in her aunt's villa outside Athens, now feels that she does not want to return to Moscow, where her husband of a week, Sergei Kauzov, is waiting for her, a friend said here today. Although she still has affection for Mr. Kauzov, said the friend, in whom the heiress confided, she is unsure whether she wants to resume the marriage.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Niagara Olfactory Impact
description: Under the watchful eye of their parent company, Occidental Petroleum, most of the Hooker Chemical and Plastics Corporation's executives are very hesitant to comment on their dumping of chemicals into the Love Canal except to say that, according to the deed, now held by the Niagara Board of Education, they are not liable for any results of the leeching of the wastes.

title: Columbia Doctor Says She Told Vande Wiele To Halt Implant Plan
description: A doctor testified yesterday that she had urged a Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center official to intervene in a plan to implant an embryo in a Florida woman because, as a specialist in the early development of human reproductive cells, she was convinced that the implant would have imperiled the patient's health.

title: U.S. Loses Vietnam Loan Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Over the formal objections of the United States, the World Bank todayapproved its first loan to Vietnam. The purpose is to assist in redeveloping an agricultural area severely damaged by the war.

title: France Fights Fires on Corsica
description: AJACCIO, Corsica, Aug. 8 (Reuters)France airlifted firemen and Foreign Legionnaires to this Mediterranean island colony today to combat raging forest fires.

title: Vendor's Stock in Big Jump
description: The Servomation Corporation, the object of a tender offer, jumped more than 10 points yesterday, while the general stock market showed rising prices after exhibiting weakness early in the session. Certain casinorelated issues Dosted sham eains.

title: S.E.C. Head Warns Corporate Lawyers on Ethics
description: Harold M. Williams, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, yesterday urged lawyers to do what is ethical, not merely legal. He warned that, unless lawyers adopted codes of conduct that bear this broader vision and enhanced corporate accountability, the Federal Government would be forced to play greater role in supervising the profession.

title: Radio
description: 64 A.M. WKCR. Cello Concerto, Tischenko; Symphony No. 3, Nielsen; Symphony No. 2, Prokofiev.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The price of color television sets is heading upward, as much as 4 percent, and some other consumer prices on electronics products are going up with them.

title: RHODESIA PROHIBITS SOME RACIAL CURBS
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 8  Rhodesia's biracial transitional Government announced today a series of measures that will make it illegal for whites to deny blacks access to public facilities such as hotels, movies and swimming pools.

title: Utah's Out of It
description: LEWISTON, Idaho  The crumbling Carter Administration is vindicating those Washington sages who warned against giving the Presidency to outsiders from offbeat states like Georgia.

title: Curbs Could Alter Role of Press, Lawyers Are Told
description: The role of the press as an overseer of government and society, free to expose their failures and weaknesses, will be significantly altered if courts around the country continue a pattern of forcing reporters to disclose information that was given to them in confidence, three leading journalists argued yesterday before members of the American Bar Association.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Niagara Olfactory Impact
description: Although they are prevented from saying so, executives of the Hooker Chemical and Plastics Corporation are officially prevented by their parent company, Occidental Petroleum, from commenting on the Love Canal issue, except to say that although they are concerned, they are not liable for any results of the motion of the chemical wastes.

title: Pop Haines and Other Deities
description: On the same weekend when Eddie Mathews, a batter, was inducted into the Hall of Fame, Jesse Joseph Haines, pitcher already enshrined for the ages, took off for the big bull pen in the sky. Pop Haines was 85 years old and lust wore out, though that was uncharacteristii. Not counting the 1918 season, when he had a cup of coffee with the Cincinnati Reds. Pop played 18 years in a row for the St. Louis Cardinals, breaking, in at the age of 26 and continuing to ornament the Major league scene until he was going on 45. As late as his 42d year he was a World Series pitcher, and when at last the Cardinals turned him loose, it wasn't because he had nothing left. They released him so he could try his hand at managing in the minors. That turned out to be not, his dish. He had hated the constant. travel and the hotel living in the majors and he couldn't abide the bus hauls and fleabags of the bushes.

title: Levi Sued On Pricing
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8 (AP)  The State of Connecticut filed a $6 million lawsuit today against Levi Strauss & Company, charging that the world's largest maker of blue jeans coerced retailers to fix prices.

title: Republicans in State Senate Seek Assurance on Purchase of Rikers
description: ALBANY, Aug. 8  The Senate's Republican leadership would endorse a plan for the state to take over the New York City's jail complex at Rikers Island there were written assurances of its cost and of the city's commitment to provide alternatives for its own use, a party spokesman said today.

title: Liner America Ordered Auctioned to Settle Debts
description: The cruise ship America, beached in the custody of a Federal marshal after two disastrous pleasure cruises, has been ordered sold at auction to satisfy creditors claims.

title: 2017 Loss to Falcons Spotlights Jets Big Problem: Lack of Depth
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 8  It was not the first time Coach Walt Michaels had been asked the question: Why don't, the Jets simply pick up defensive backS that strong teams like Dallas or Oakland drop? A team such as the Cowboys wouldn't draft or sign a player in the first place unless he was outstanding, would they?

title: Pouring Pointers
description: While more Americans than ever are drinking beer, many are not drinking it correctly.

title: VOTERS IN MICHIGAN CHOOSE CANDIDATES
description: DETROIT, Wednesday, Aug. 9  William B.. Fitzgerald, a young Michigan State Senator, has won the Democratic primary contest to face Governor William K. Milliken this fall.

title: Affirmed Scores, but Close
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 8  A few yards past the finish line in today's $36,925 Jim Dandy Stakes, tirstplace Affirmed pricked his ears forward as if to ask his fans, What were you so worried about?

title: COMMODITY MARKETS Futures in Swiss Francs And German Marks Rise
description: Prices of futures in Swiss francs and West German marks rose to record levels against the dollar yesterday on the International Monetary Market of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, as the price of gold jumped.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: The frontal system that brought showers to the East for more than a week is decaying; the cloud system associated with the front is spiraling out to sea off the New England coast. Locally heavy thunderstorms are affecting the central Gulf States. Tropical storm  Bess  continues to weaken over eastern Mexico and tropical storm  Cora  is about 1,400 miles east of San Juan. P.R.

title: Studies Hint Dust in Air Won't Curb Rising Temperature
description: MAUNA LOA OBSERVATORY, Hawaii  Although observations here document a longterm rise in carbon dioxide content of the atmosphere, presumably caused by worldwide fuel burning, there is no evidence of a parallel rise in dust pollution that many climatologists have thought would temper the carbon dioxide's warming effect.

title: Taxpayers in Nassau Invited to Give Views
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 8  The Nassau County Board of Supervisors today in. vited the taxpayers to attend a public forum to solicit their views on ways to cut countyGovernment costs.

title: Lawyers Group Gives an Award To The Times for Law Coverage
description: The New York County Lawyers' Association yesterday honored The New York Times for conspicuous public service in its coverage of the law.

title: Recipes: A 3Pack
description: It is reasonable to assume that beer, one of the earliest of man's fermented beverages, was one of humanity's earliest cooking liquids. In the kitchen, flat as old seltzer or effervescent as new champagne, it has an impressive spectrum of uses. Below are three of them  a bread, the best carbonnade flamande we've ever eaten, from Isabelle Marique, proprietor of the Marique School of French Cooking in Manhattan, and a beer soup. Reactions to such a soup vary. To some it is a curious delight. Others find it vile and not without reason.

title: Black Groups Giving More to United College Fund
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8  Standing offstage in the darkened wings of Jones Hall here, Christopher Edley, executive director of the United Negro College Fund, watched the stage suddenly flood with movement and music as the Spinners took over his audience.

title: Vatican. Workmen Prepare a Tomb for Pope Paul in Crypt Beneath St. Peter's Basilica
description: ROME, Aug. 8  Workmen with awls and sledgehammers dug a deep tomb today in the foundation of the crypt of St. Peter's Basilica where Pope Paul VI will be buried near what Roman Catholics revere as the sepulcher of St. Peter, the prince of apostles.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: The International Business Machines Corporation has reorganized its System Products division into two new divisions  Data Systems and System Productsand appointed John E. Bertram president of the Data Systems division, and Jack D. Kuchler president of the System Products division.

title: PROARMS COALITION FORMED IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The creation of a new Congressional coalition highly critical of the Carter Administration's defense policies was announced today, with 148 members calling for the United States to achieve military superiority over the Soviet Union.

title: Chicken The Soothing Sandwich
description: EVERY eater, no matter how dedicated, intrepid or sophisticated, now and then feels the need gain comfort from one of perhaps several securityblanket foods, soothing and satisfying palliatives to frazzled nerves and frayed tempers, or overstimulated psyches and palates in need of gentle surcease. And it is probable that such foods come to mind most often at this season, when the wilting heat midsummer takes its toll on appetites, or the exhaustion of vacation travel sets in.

title: Bronx Community Board Delays U.S.City Housing Plan Decision
description: After two hours of sometimes heated debate, a community board in the South Bronx last night postponed a decision on endorsing or disapproving the first housingconstruction proposal under the Federal and city program to rebuild the slum area.

title: EARNINGS McDermott's Net Drops
description: J. Ray McDermott & Company reported yesterday a 29.2 percent drop in its earnings for the first fiscal quarter ended June 30, to $32.3 million, or 76 cents a share, from $45.6 million, or $1.45 a share, in the similar three months last year.

title: Jazz. Klemmer and Shaw
description: AFREE outdoor jazz concert offered by WRVRFM and the Department of Parks,ecreadon, and Cultural Affairs, brought an audience estimated by the station at more than 10,000 to the Band Shell in Central Park on Monday evening to hear the John Klenuner Group and the Woody Shaw Ouintet.

title: New York Cheers, and the President Signs
description: When President Carter walked down the steps of City Hall shortly before P.M. yesterday, he faced a crowd of 5,000 spectators. It was a panorama of New York  blacks, whites, Chinese, Orthodox Jews with beards and yarmulkes, stockbrokers in pinstripe suits and youths in brightly colored Tshirts. After the band stopped playing Happy Days Are Here Again, the crowd cheered.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: JUST when you thought it was safe to listen someone jaw, we have this memorial to conversation in the summer of 78: While sitting around a swimming pool at Westhampton Beach last week, writes Molly Towbin, I observed a beautiful towheaded boy, about 21/2 years old, with his parents. He walked over to the steps of the swimming pool, held on to the railing, and with little encouragement from me, walked down two steps.

title: News Summary
description: Ways to break the Mideast deadlock will be discussed by President Carter, President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel on Sept. 5 at Camp David, Md., the White House announced. A senior Administration official said that Mr. Carter had decided to arrange the summit meeting not because the chances for peace are right now so high, but because the stakes in peace are very high and the risks, in fact, have risen. [Page Al, Columns 5.6.]

title: Stolen Prize Parrot Recovered
description: After a threemonth search by detectives, friends and people interested in a $10,000 reward, George, prize scarlet macaw parrot who was stolen from a Queens pet store, was returned to his owner yesterday.

title: United Press International
description: REBUILDING: Workers inside the Hartford Civic Center repairing concrete platforms for seats in the auditorium. arena, heavily damaged last winter when its roof collapsed from weight of accumulated snow, is being reconstructed.

title: An Update on the Fiscal Crisis of New York City
description: President Carter's signature on the Federal loanguarantee bill closes a long, dramatic chapter in New York City's struggle to hold off bankruptcy and the economic and social chaos that would result.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: COOKING is an adventure and one of the most intriguing aspects of it can innovations that come about by blending foods on an international scale. One of the best and most hastily made Greek dishes is known as garides me feta shrimp baked with feta cheese. There are many variations the dish; dill is sometimes added, or parsley, or capers. Some cooks also add dash of that potent white spirit ouzo, which provides'a nice anise or licorice taste the dish.

title: Paper in Detroit Offers To Help Times on Fine
description: The Detroit News offered yesterday to pay one day's fine  $5,000  for The New York Times in the M. A. Farber case to symbolize the belief that the entire American Press was involved in the controversy.

title: Judge Denies 2 Russians Protection as Diplomats
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8 (AP)  A federal judge refused today to dismiss espionage charges against two Russians employed by the United Nations, saying they were not protected by diplomatic immunity.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 8 (UPI)  A former sports agent, Richard Sorkin, convicted of stealing more than $600,000 entrusted to him by 31 professional hockey and basketball players, has begun serving a prison term of up to three years.

title: Advertising
description: JUST FOR YOU! is a proposed magazine that may be the ultimate in target marketing and magazine commercialization  a publication through which advertisers in noncoMpetitive environment can reach only women who are not currently using their producti or services.

title: Deaths
description: BANCROFTEsther died in Wilmington Del on August 8th; 1978, age 81, daughter of the late John and Charlotte Boswell Bancroft, mother of Albert Gordon Matthews Jr. Funeral services and interment private. Please omit flowers.

title: Events
description: HOLIDAY ON ICE. starring Peggy Fleming. At Madison Square Garden. 7:30. Through Aug. 20.

title: L.I. High School Athlete Dies
description: A star athlete at the Elmont Memorial High School in Elmont, L.I., collapsed and died at his home Monday night after tossing a football back and forth with friend for about an hour. The youth, Peter Arena, 17 years old, who was to have entered his senior year at the high school this fall, returned to his home at 2081 Baylis Avenue, and collapsed. An autopsy failed to disclose the cause of death.

title: $100,000 Fund Sought in Drive To Sue Port Authority Over SST
description: Calling the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey arrogant in its diftegard for the people in communities near Kennedy International and La Guaidia Airports, Carol Berman, leader of the Emergency Coalition to Stop the SST, said she hoped to raise $100,000 to fin6pce the $1.84 million suit that a group of Long Island individuals have brought against the authority.

title: Canada Jobless Rate Off
description: OTTAWA, Aug, 8 (UPI)  Despite an increase in student unemployment over a year ago, Statistics Canada reported today that the seasonally adjusted jobless rate was down twotenths of 1 percent in July from the average in the four previous months.

title: San Francisco's Housing Agency Under Fire for Financial Actions
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8  The San Francisco Housing Authority, a semiautonomous agency that administers 9,100 units of public lowcost housing, is under fire on grounds that it is incompetently run and lacks financial control.

title: Moderate Quake in Alaska
description: PALMER, Alaska, Aug. 8 (UPI)  A moderate earthquake struck south central Alaska early today but there were no reports of damage or injury, the National Weather Service said.

title: The Home BreWer Hops to It
description: In basements and kitchens across the country, home brewers may soon be reaching into their refrigerators for a homemade bottle of beer that is unequivocally legal.

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 15 national television shows of the ast week (Monday, July 31, to Sunday. August 6). listed according to their rank in the ratings compiled by the A.C. Nielsen Company. A rating is a percentage of the total number of United States households with television sets.

title: Garcia Files Chapter XI Petitions
description: The Garcia Corporation, a Teaneck, N.J., producer of fishing tackle and other sporting goods, said that it had filed petitions for an arrangement with creditors under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: LAWSUIT DISMISSED AGAINST NBCTV
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8  An $11 million negligence suit against the National Broadcasting Company was thrown out of court today after the plaintiff's lawyer conceded that he could not meet the test the judge had established for stripping the network of the.protection of the First Amendment.

title: Instructor at Brooklyn College Dismissed by Board
description: Instructor at Brooklyn College Dismissed by Board

title: Money
description: TUESDAY, AUG. 8, 1978

title: Kitchen Inventions Including a Gizmo to Hold Gadgets
description: For several months now, there has been a good deal of talk here and there (meaning New York and California) about a new cream maker, an import from England. The trade name of the product is Bel. It is a simply constructed item that resembles a syruppourer. It consists of a plastic bottom jar onto which is screwed a plastic cup with a handle. As the handle is pumped up and down, a liquid poured into the upper cup will flow down. The way to make cream in the gadget is this:

title: Most Elected Officials in a Survey Disagree With Jersey Press Ruling
description: Most elected officials disagree with the New Jersey judge who levied heavy fines against The New York Times and jailed one of its reporters, M. A. Farber, for refusing to turn over notes gathered in an investigation, an Associated Press survey shows.

title: Rangers Join Appeal On Murdoch Suspension
description: The New York Rangers have joined with Don Murdoch's lawyers in appealing his minimum 40game suspension from play in the National Hockey League. The suspension stems from Murdoch's conviction last April on charge of possession of cocaine.

title: F. E. ANDREWS DIES; FOUNDATION EXPERT
description: F. Emerson Andrews, an author, foundation consultant and former president of the Foundation Center in New York, died Monday in a Burlington, Vt., hospital near his summer home on Isle La Motte in Lake Champlain. He was 76 years old and lived in Tenafly, N.J.

title: Miss Onassis Now Called Unsure On Rejoining Husband in Soviet
description: ATHENS, Aug. 8  Christina Onassis, sequestered in her aunt's villa outside Athens, now feels that she does not want to return to Moscow, where her husband of a week, Sergei Kauzov, is waiting for her, a friend said here today. Although sne sun nas auecnOn tor Mr. Kauzov, said the friend, in whom the heiress confided, she is unsure whether she wants to resume the marriage.

title: Canadian Entry on Rail
description: The draw for post positions for the International Trot Saturday night at Roosevelt Raceway was held yesterday. The Canadian entry got the rail position for the $200,000 race.

title: 2 Senators Hail T.N.J. As Bus Operator Asks Renewed State Grants
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8  Two members of the Senate Transportation Committee said today they were impressed by the operations of Transport of New Jersey, the state's largest bus company, which seeking a renewal of $30 million in state financial assistance.

title: A.B.A. Unit Urges Less Regulation
description: Concluding a threeyear study, a blueribbon commission of the American Bar Association yesterday called for a fundamental overhaul of the Federal regulatory process and the easing of direct Government intervention in the economy.

title: Radio
description: 64 A.M. WKCR. Cello Concerto, Tischenko; Symphony No. 3, Nielsen; Symphony No. 2, Prokofiev.

title: Nixon's Umm History
description: DURHAM, N.C.  Some days before Richard M. Nixofi's autobiography was sprung on the world at large, I got a call from a magazine in New York saying that it had the first nine words  I was born in a house my father built and what did I Make of that? Well, is it true? Now I am beginning to think that was profound after all.

title: O'NEILL'S LIST OMITS SOME CARTER GOALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., the Speaker of the How, proclaimed a minimum program today of must legislation for the rest of the session. His list omitted such cherished Carter Administration goals as Civil Service legislation, airline deregulatiim and control of hospital costs.

title: U.N. LEBANON CHIEF APPEALS TO ISRAELIS; He Asks Them to Exert Pressure On Christians to Halt Shelling
description: KAWKABA, Lebanon, Aug. 8  The commander of the United Nations peacekeeping force in Lebanon expressed the hope today that Israel would use its influence to get the Lebanese Christian militias to stop shelling United Nations and Lebanese Army Croons.

title: Name for Bee Center Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  The Senate Agriculture Committee today unanimously approved a bill naming the beeresearch laboratory at Tucson, Ariz., the Carl Hayden Bee Research Center.

title: Senate Committee Votes New Tax Cut for Elderly
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)The Senate Finance Committee voted unanimously today for a new tax cut of up to $112.50 a year for persons 65 and older.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Bolivia probably will lose $14 million in American military aid as a result of the Carter Administration's reaction to the aborted Bolivian elections of last month, State Department officials said today.

title: CORE Supporting Bill That Gives Tax Credit For Private School Fee
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The Congress of Racial Equality, once in the forefront of the move to desegregate the public schools, today threw its support behind a bill to give tax relief to parents who send their children to private elementary and secondary schools.

title: Keesing/Berkebiles
description: SUMMER MUSES: Adrian Craycroft and Karen McGill practicing on flute at Westfield Summer Workshop for the Creative Arts. Begun in 172, workshop offers 100 courses over a fiveweek period.

title: WESTCHESTER KILLS CON ED REFERENDUM
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 8  A Republicandominated Board of Legislators today killed a controversial plan to give voters an opportunity this November to vote on whether they favored a county takeover of the Consolidated Edison Company's electricdistribution system. in Westchester.

title: O'NEILL'S LIST OMITS SOME CARTER GOALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., the Speaker of the House, proclaimed a minimum program today of must legislation for the rest of the session. His list omitted such cherished Carter Administration goals as Civil Service legislation, airline deregulation and control of hospital costs.

title: Publishers Postpone Deadline on Pressmen's Contract
description: The publishers of the city's three major newspapers, The Daily News, The New York Post and The New York Times, agreed last night to postpone the deadline for reaching an agreement with the pressmen until 6 P.M. tonight.

title: India Disappointed in Birth Control by Persuasion
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 8  Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai, conceding that there have been substantial setbacks in India's birthcontrol program, has issued a new appeal against unlimited population growth.

title: Partisan Review Is Movingto Boston
description: Partisan Review, the literarypolitical quarterly founded in New York in 1939, will move its editorial offices to Boston this summer, under the aegis of Boston University. For the last 15 years, the publication has been at Rutgers University, New Brunswick. N. J.

title: Court to Rule on TV Film on Blacks
description: Whether or not Blacks Britannica is broadcast as scheduled on PBS this week depends on a decision by a court in Boston, which in effect has been asked to determine whether the film is the property of its producer or of the station that employed him.

title: Q & A
description: Q.A recipe you recently published called for two skinless, boneless chicken breasts, split in half. Does that mean the breast meat from one or two chickens?

title: United Press Internaticoal
description: GETTING TOGETHER ON URBAN POLICY: Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson Newark greeted Mayors Arthur J. Holland, left, of Trenton and Francis F. Smith of Jersey City yesterday in Washington, as mayors from across the country met to lobby for components of President Carter's urban policy.

title: U.S. Sues B. F. Goodrich
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The Department of Justice filed a civil antitrust suit today accusing the B. F. Goodrich Company of a conspiracy to fix prices of its tires in several Western states. The suit asks a Federal court to forbid such practices in the future.

title: Yankees Beat Brewers, 30; Caldwell Loses to Tidrow; Yankees Box Score
description: Based upon the Milwaukee Brewers success in general and Mike Caldwell's wizardry in particular against the Yankees this season, last night did not figure to be an especially pleasant time for the New Yorkers at Yankee Stadium.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A decision to construct a Veterans Administration hospital in Carilden went to a HouseSenate conference committee yesterday after gaining final approval in the Senate.

title: Business Records
description: MAXINE LAKE, Route 209, Box 68. Ellenyille, N.Y. Li. abilities. S10,421: assets, none.

title: Thompson, 20, Achieves 2d Best Decathlon Total
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Aug. 8 (AP)  Daley Thompson, a strong and brash English athlete, fell short in his attempt to break Bruce Jenner's world decathlon record, but he amassed the second highest total in history today at the Commonwealth Games.

title: Lockheed Introduces Revised Small L1011
description: BURBANK, Calif., Aug. 8  Acknowledging that the success of the L1011 TriStar program is critical to the wellbeing of Lockheed over the next 10 years, the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation introduced today the revised version of its smaller, more fuelefficient L1011400 into the competition for a share of the midsized, mediumrange aircraft market.

title: U.S. JUDGE REFUSES TO RELEASE FARBER
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8  Federal District Judge Frederick B. Lacey refused tonight to free M. A. Farber of The New York Times from jail, at least for the time being, but said he would hold a hearing here Friday morning on whether Mr. Farber should be released.

title: Private Lives
description: THIS was before the airconditioner dropped out of the ninthfloor window of a nearby apartment house, bounced off the roof of the seedy disco and ricocheted into my garden. It was before my newspaper took away all our typewriters, took away all our noise, and gave us machines with ghosts in them, machines that watch us while we try to write. It was before Billy Martin and Peter Bourne and Christina Onassis and the testtube baby and the inscrutable yen. It was, in other words, back in the days, just a few weeks ago, when thought I could cope.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The dollar broke through a psychological barrier to touch a record low against the West German mark of 1.9890 marks to the dollar yesterday before closing below two marks for the first time. It sank against other currencies on world foreignexchange markets amid fears of an imminent rise in oil prices.

title: Detectives Arrested in Abduction
description: Two North Bergin detectives were arrested in Manhattan yesterday and charged with the abduction of a 24yearold woman from the Times Square area last Jan. 14.

title: The Favorites
description: The writer Joseph Wechsberg once recalled how, as young man, he traveled the world selling brewery supplies to lonely German and Czech brewmasters who had migrated to China, Java, Japan and Milwaukee to ply their trade. In fact, most good beers in the world still show the strong influence of those old Middle Europeans. Everywhere, that is, but in this country. Somehow, we have managed to produce an almost characterless product that bears only a vague resemblance to the rich, fullbodied, fullflavored beers produced abroad.

title: Berkey Advances in Suit
description: Berkey Photo Inc. won another round in its court battle to collect $81.4 million in damages from the Eastman Kodak Company in one of the largest antitrust cases in history.

title: Where Have All the Breweries Gone?
description: In the beginning it was the Red Lion Brewery in Nieuw Amsterdam of 1660; in the end it was the last brown bottle of Schaefer packaged for shipping out of closed brewery in Williamsburg on March 30, 1976.

title: Bitter Words Mark First Session Of ChinaVietnam. Refugee Talks
description: PEKING, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Talks between China and Vietnam on the future of one million ethnic Chinese in Vietnam got off to an acrimonious start in Hanoi today, with a Chinese minister accusing Hanoi of gravely impairing relations between the two countries.

title: Officer Killed as Philadelphia Radicals Are Evicted
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8  A policeman was shot to death and 18 other persons, 12 of them policemen and firemen, were injured here this morning as law enforcement officers stormed a barricaded house of selfstyled revolutionaries with bulldozer, fire hoses and tear gas.

title: Best Buys
description: ANOTHER record high in the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City was established last week, when the cost of the 41item market basket of the City Department of Consumer Affairs reached $84.63.

title: The New York Times /Jack Manning
description: EHEARSAL IN THE PARK: Andre Kostelanetz conducting the New York Philharmonic in a rehearsal at the Sheep Meadow in Central Park yesterday for the orchestra's opening summer concert in the park last night.

title: Choice of NonItalian Pope Held Possible but Unlikely
description: ROME, Aug. 8  Churchmen here who are familiar with the trends and moods in the Roman Catholic hierarchy throughout the world say the election of a nonItalian pope for the first time in 456 years is possible but not highly probable.

title: Carter Signs Aid Bill for New York At a Gala Celebration at City Hall
description: Before a cheering crowd of 5,000 people in front of City Hall, President Carter signed a bill yesterday to give New York City $1.65 billion of Federal loan guarantees, the key to its continuing effort to avoid banknintcv.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: So vhat, you may well say. So what if there's yet another little bag that miraculously unzips and ends up as a more than generous big bag. So this is to tell you that there is now a bag that not only converts from small to big, but is as handsome can be. The bag has a couple of other features that are worthy of note. It changes size so simply that even people who are all thumbs (I confess) are able to handle and the price is moderate by almoSt any standard. There.are three sizeg, with the smallest version selling for about $14, the middle one for $22, or thereabout, and larlest for around $35. Each starts out as a neatlooking, longshoulderstrap compact. and expands to a carrying case with double handles. There's ample room side for a casual weekend wardrobe, and there are also two outside pockets, one with flap and one with zipper. The colors include brown, dark green and black, with a camel trim, and the design comes from a company called Pavanne. The luggage department at Saks Fifth Avenue, and the Plymouth stores are among those who have ordered the bag and, all things being equal, should have it by now.

title: 10th Game Is 9th Draw, As Chess War Heats Up
description: BAGUIO, the Philippines, Aug (Reuters)  Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union and Viktor Korchnoi tonight battled to their ninth draw in the World Chess Championship after their fragile personal relations had sunk to the lowest level so far. in a game in which neither player shone, Karpov made the mistake of trying to rush his opponent while Korchnoi was having his characteristic time trouble. Karpov, the present champion, landed himself in a tangle and threw away his advantage.

title: Connecticut's Controversial Police Head to Retire
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8  Connecticut's cqintroversial State Police Commissioner, Edward Leonard, today announced his retirement, citing personal reasons and making vague allegations about political interference in his department.

title: Personal Health: Herbs Can Be Hazardous
description: AN elderly couple from Chehalis, Wash., had been to health spa that recommended comfrey tea as an herbal remedy for their arthritis. The wife picked what she thought was comfrey and prepared tea, which the couple drank with lunch. Within an hour they were overcome with nausea, vomitinn and dizziness.

title: Prosecution Disputes Chemist's DogHair Findings
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Aug. 8  The prosecution in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich challenged today the determination a chemist made that dog hairs were clinging to some of the syringes and other items taken from Dr. Jascalevich's hospital locker.

title: Library for Blind an Architectural Triumph
description: CHICAGO THERE has been an undeclared war going on for some time between the nation's highdesign architects and the advocates of better buildings for the handicapped.

title: Actors in Movie On Child Sex Say They Are Unpaid
description: GREENFIELD, Mass., Aug. 8 (AP) A trail of unpaid actors and creditors is all that remains of a company that began filming a movie about child sex on location in Franklin County earlier this year, according to The Greenfield Recorder.

title: HealthCode Violations Charged To 3 Food Places in New York
description: The New York City Health. Department yesterday cited three food places that violated the Health Code, and two that corrected earlier violations. The places listed were:

title: Jailed South Korean Fasts
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Kim Dae Jung, the opposition politician who ran against President Park Chung Hee in the 1971 South Korean election and is now jailed under a presidential emergency decree, was carrying out a daylong fast today to mark the anniversary of his kidnapping from Japan by unidentified Koreans five years ago, his wife said here today.

title: Notes on People
description: HE leader of the American Civil Liberties Union's successful support of the right of American Nazis to march in Skokie, Ill., is resigning from his post. David M. Hamlin, executive director of the A.C.L.U.'s Illinois division. said. I wish to make abundantly clear that my resignation is no way a repudiation of the work I have done or the prganization I have served. Fatigue was one factor in his decision, said Mr. Hamlin, who was in his post for four years. He said would like to do some writing, possibly about the civil liberties group's successful Supreme Court challenges of a series of Skokie ordinances designed to prevent the Nazis march.

title: Expos Waste Little Time, Rout Mets
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 8.  Just before the start of tonight's game between the New York Mets and the Montreal Expos, an exhibition by a cast of 200 men in military garb was presented. Blasts from a small field cannon repeatedly shattered the quiet of Olympic Stadium.

title: Mauch Is Hospitalized
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (AP)  The Minnesota Twins Manager, Gene Mauch, was admitted to St. Mary's Hospital in Minneapolis today for treatment cf an infected right foot. He is expected to remain hospitalized until this weekend. Coach Jerry Zimmerman will run the club.

title: Angels Were Weeping for Pope, Say Villagers in an Alpine Storm
description: DRUDGNO, Italy, Aug. 8  The news that the Pope was dead came on Sunday night to this Alpine village, and the rain began with a biblical vengeance only a few minutes later.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: The proposal voted by the House Ways and Means Committee to index capital gains for inflation is destined to stir a lively debate. Indexing would be achieved by increasing the cost basis of three kinds of capital assets  corporate stock, real estate and plant and equipment  with increases in the consumer price index.

title: A Plea for Alchemy
description: KENDALL PARK, N.J.  Gerontologists are noble souls who strive valiantly to prolong the lives of the elderly. But they are seriously Handicapped; they can't issue the one prescription that would be practically a panacea. They can't write: Rx: to De taken trequentiy in large doses. Megavitamin therapy is fine, but megabuck therapy would be infinitely better.

title: News Summary
description: Ways to break the Mideast deadlock will be discussed by President Carter, President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel on Sept. 5 at Camp David, Md., the White House announced. A senior Administration official said that Mr. Carter had decided to arrange the summit meeting not because the chances for peace are right now so high, but because the stakes in peace are very high and the risks, in fact, have risen. [Page Al, Columns 55.]

title: Candlestick Park Surface Will Become Grass Again
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8 (UPI) It's back to nature for the playing surface at Candlestick Park, home of the baseball Giants and football 49ers.

title: Carter Signs Aid Bill for New York At a Gala Celebration at City Hall
description: Before a cheering crowd of 5,000 people in front of. City Hall, President Carter Signed a bill yesterday to give New York City $1.65 billion of Federal loan guarantees, the key to its continuing effort to avoid bankruptcy.

title: RIGHTS CROUP FINDS GROWING RACIAL GAP
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8  The economic gap between blacks and whites is widening, according to a report by the National Urban League, with the proportion of upperincome black families steadily declining and that of middleincome black families remaining essentially unchanged from its 1972 level.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Milwaukee Brewers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (Radio WINS, 8 P.M.)

title: President Gets a Letter From Koch on the Dais
description: As he started speaking yesterday on the steps of City Hall, President Carter noted that Mayor Koch had not handed him any letters on this trip to New York.

title: Diamond Mines Fear Future
description: ORANJEMUND, SouthWest Africa  For much of his adult life, Wapota Haufiku has been scouring the Atlantic beaches near here for his employer, De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd.

title: CARTER TO MEET BEGIN AND SADAT IN THE U.S. SEPT. 5
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The White House announced today that President Carter would meet Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel and President Anwar e1Sadat of Egypt on Sept. 5 to discuss ways of breaking the Middle East deadlock. The meeting will be at Camp David, the Presidential retreat in the Maryland mountains.

title: Carey Far Outspending His Rivals For Summer TV and Radio Spots
description: With up to $800,000 budgeted for radio and television air time alone during the normally quiet summer months, Governor Carey is far outspending Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak and State Senator Jeremiah B. Bloom, his rivals for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: Sadat Says He Agreed to Meeting When U.S. Accepted a Wider Role
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug. 8  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said tonight that he had agreed to attend the meeting at Camp David next month with President Carter and Prime Minister Menachem Begin because of an American commitment to become a full partner in Middle East mace negotiations.

title: Purchase of the Nets: Ready to Wrap It Up
description: Alan Cohen, head of the syndicate that has agreed to buy the New Jersey Nets from Roy Boe, will present an unfinished plan for the deal to the National Basketball Association board of governors today in Chicago.

title: Economic Scene
description: NATIONAL energy policy and the automotive industry are on a collision course. At stake for the Government is it's best hope for conserving oil supplies and reducing imports. At stake for the industry is the viability of several of its companies. At stake for consumers is more inflation.

title: Meany Predicts Inflation in U.S. Will Accelerate
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 8  George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, said today there was every indication that the nation's inflation rate will go up.

title: A New Gamble on Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Concern about the risk of new hostilities in the Middle East was an important element in persuading President Carter to take the bold initiative of inviting Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt here next month to seek breakthrough.

title: PROARMS COALITION FORMED IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The creation of a new Congressional coalition highly critical of the Carter Administration's defense policies was announced today, with 148 members calling for the United States to achieve military superiority over the Soviet Union.

title: Wine Talk
description: HERE may be a more fascinating group of businessmen in the world than the wine merchants of Bordeaux, but none that has been around so long. Bie corporations boast of their 75th or 100th anniversaries. There have been sophisticated wine merchants on the banks of the Gironde River in Bordeaux for almost a thousand years.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) over.thecounter.

title: Job Hunt: How to Succeed by Really Trying
description: Ironically, all of the weapons he had helped others to hone for their own saults on the job market sumwriting, the ability to handle an interview and to match realistically one's skills with job possibilitieshad proved ineffectual his own life.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A small tornado touched down briefly in Poughkeepsie yesterday, damaging a wall of the Standard Glass Works building and uprooting some trees in the area. But there were no reports of injuries. Several 60foot pines in the area were uprooted.

title: Honduran Junta Pledges Election
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Three generals who overthrew President Juan Alberto Melgar Castro in a bloodless coup last night promised today that they wbuld hold free elections in 1980.

title: Women's Role In U.S. Jaycees Opposed Again
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8  The president of the United States Jaycees reaffirmed today his recent ultimatum against female membership and predicted that relatively few chapters would lose their charters because of it.

title: Louisiana Unit Sets Bond Issue
description: The Louisiana Offshore Terminal Authority announced yesterday that it expected to market its first bond issue, $450 million of deepwater port revenue bonds, on Aug. 23 through an underwriting syndicate managed by the First Boston Corporation.

title: Virginia G.O.P. Likely To Nominate Warner
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 8 (AP)  Former Navy Secretary John W. Warner emerged today as the almost certain choice of Virginia Republicans to replace Richard Obenshain, who died last week in a plane crash, as the party's candidate for the Senate.

title: Music: Schwthaz's Baton
description: ALL of a sudden, it seems (though that is not quite the case), thriving inttrumental virtuosos in surprising numbers are jumping off the performers deck into the sea of conducting, sometimes with little more than ambition and fond wishes to keep them afloat.

title: 2 Independents Setting Sights On Carey's Job
description: A New York City businessman and West Virginia lawyer have entered New York's gubernatorial contest, announcing their independent candidacies for the November election. Both offer novel prescriptions to save the state from Establishment politicians.

title: Busbee and Nunn Easily Capture Nominations in Georgia Primary
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8 Governor George Busbee and Senator Sam Nunn both easily won renomination today in Georgia's Democratic primary election.

title: Central Park's Florid Fauna
description: Where would you go if you wanted to see a bunch tortoises wearing bandannas; five fullgrown macaws riding the handlebars of a collapsible bike; a skunk; some monkeys; an ocelot, and a boa constrictor?

title: Fidrych Is Out For the Season
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8 (AP)  Mark (The Bird) Fidrych, the Detroit Tigers colorful young right hander, was sidelined today for the rest of the baseball season.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: As the credit markets continued to move toward lower interest rates yesterday, investment bankers priced new issue of highgrade utility bonds to yield 8.75 percent, more than half a percentage point below rates on similar securities in midJuly.

title: Tasks for the JobSeeker
description: The course crea:ed by John Crystal, a former spy, instructs jobseekers to reconnoiter the world of work and infiltrate it. This unconventional process involves numerous timeconsuming tasks. As extracted from the book Mr. Crystal wrote with Richard N. Bolles, Where Do I Go From Here With My Life? (The Seabury Press), they include:

title: Apples Losing Tempers and Polish
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 8  Billie Jean King is still trying to regain her form, JoAnne Russell is still doing crossword puzzles, Vitas Gerulaitis is still griping about the fans, Ray Ruffels lost his cool and the New York Apples are still losing.

title: Comparative Beer Ads: Legal Questions Raised
description: WASHINGTON  A German beer stein filled with a frothy brew flashes across a television screen. Are you drinking a wellknown German beer that isn't really German? queries a throaty announcer. Read the label, he continues.

title: Citizens Campaign Against a Clifton Paper Upheld
description: PATERSON, Aug. 8  A judge upheld today the right of a group of Clifton residents to urge their neighbors to cease buying or advertising in The Independent Prospector, a Clifton weekly whose news content they found objectionable.

title: Suffolk Legislators Vote Against Referendum on Supervisor Panel
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Aug. 8  The Suffolk County Legislature voted today against giving county voters the opportunity in November to abolish the Legislature and replace it with a board of supervisors.

title: McVay Defends Giants Poor Passing in 217 Exhibition Victory Over Browns
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 8 The Giants won their preseason opener last night, but they completed only three passes doing it. But before anyone could suggest that maybe there's a quarterback problem, Coach John McVay jumped to the defense today of his three young signalcallers.

title: A New Gamble on Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Concern about the risk of new hostilities in the Middle East was an important element in persuading President Carter to take the bold initiative of inviting Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt here next month to seek breakthrough.

title: The Letter of the Law
description: When Brenda Feigen and Marc Fasteau were married in 1968, they adopted a practice followed by many couples since: each adopted the surname of the other. They became happily  and widely  known as Marc Feigen Fasteau and Brenda Feigen Fasteau. But then last spring, she decided to run for the New York State Senate and collided with a new state election law.

title: San Diego Theater Rising From the Ashes
description: SAN DIEGO THE signs that decorate the burned stone are starkly simple: Old Globe Theatre. Built 1935. Destroyed by fire 1978.

title: Lo Juiching, Chinese ExChief Of Security and High Army Aide
description: PEKING, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Lo Juiching, former Minister of Public Security in China and a prominent target of radicals during the Cultural Revolution of the late 1960's, has died in Peking at the age of 72.

title: Sugar Price Lift Gains in House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Legislation that would drive up the retail price of sugar and of thousands of sugarcontaining foods was approved today by the House Agriculture Committee. Prices for sugar and sweets already are the fastest rising ones In stores this year. Table sugar prices now average $1.22 for a fivepound !me.

title: New U.S. Envoy to Jordan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  President Carter named Nicholas A. Veliotes today to become United States Ambassador to Jordan. Mr. Veliotes, 49 years old; is a native of Oakland, Calif., and has been in the Foreign Service since 1955. He now works at the State Department in Washington.

title: Deaths
description: JOSEPHSeymour, Ace 70. Of Pompano Beach, Florida. Passed away August 7, 1978. Formerly of Scarsdale. N.Y. He was a NYC attorney. Survived by wife Felice, 2 sons Marshall & James and a sister, Joan Freyberg. Services and interment today in Florida.

title: Pop: Linda Ronstadt
description: THE Forest Hills tennis stadium is a fine place for popular music, with a concert capacity of 12,500 combined with a nice sense of intimacy. But with threatenine ram ciouas, lightning and humidly heavy airnot to speak of jets roaring overhead  it can't be said that circumstances were ideal Monday night for Linda Ronstadt's only New York concert of the year. At least, she and her audience could be grateful that she was able to get through the concert without anyone's getting wet; it had been scheduled for Sunday and was rained out.

title: Leading U.S. Cardinal To Miss Papal Voting
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  John Cardinal Wright, the highestranking American in the Roman Catholic. Church, said today that health problems would prevent him from participating in the conclave in Rome to select a new none.

title: LTV Net Up Sharply
description: A more favorable economic climate and upturn in its Jones & Laughlin steel operations enabled the LTV Corporation to report yesterday secondquarter net income of $33.4 million, or $2.24 a share, in contrast to $1.6 million, or cents a share, earned in the corresponding period a year ago.

title: Cherry Tree Planted for Peace
description: NORTH KINGSTOWN, R.I., Aug. (AP)  Fifty antinuclear demonstrators rallied today at the Electrfc Boat plant here and planted a Japanese cherry tree as a symbol of peace and disarmament. They carried signs and banners reading No Nukes and Thou Shalt Not Kill. The Electric Boat plant builds nuclearpowered Trident submarines.

title: Accolades for Anchor
description: Some say it is the best beer in the. United States. Called steam beer, it is brewed only in San Francisco, in one of the nation's smallest breweries.

title: Transcript of Carter's Talk at City Hall
description: Following is a transcript of President Carter's speech as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of ABC Radio:

title: Careers
description: TO help employees survive the trauma of being discharged or otherwise terminated and to keep them from badmouthing their former employers, many companies have adopted outplacement techniaues. This usually involves the hiring of a company experienced in helping the unhappy employee learn about himself, his talents and how to package them so that another job can be found.

title: DAVID COHEN
description: David Cohen, a corporation lawyer and a member of the City Bar Association for more than 60 years, died Sunday in his home, 333 West End Avenue. He was 85 years old.

title: New Bar Association President
description: For the last several months as presidentelect of the American Bar Association, S. Shepherd Tate traveled around the country giving speeches, and he frequently noted what he considered to be damaging misconceptions about lawyers.

title: Technology
description: IF some dark night, those onrushing headlights seem an awful lot whiter and brighter than usual, don't blame it on eyestrain. Chances are they are indeed a lot brighter. The auto comoanies are starting to switch to a new type of headlight that is at least half again as bright as ordinary sealed beams.

title: Topics
description: The President's proposed reform of Civil Service is due to reach the House this week, and members will have an opportunity to undo the mischief done by their Civil Service Committee. By giving thousands of Federal unions the right to bargain over Governmentwide regulations, the amended measure threatens to bring chaos into personnel management. By putting strict limits on the duration and extent of the President's proposed senior executive service, it would discourage career officials from taking part in a plan designed to cultivate talent. And in adding provisions to reform the Hatch Act, which restricts political action by Federal employees, it has invited defeat in the Senate, which has already approved most of the President's package but which opposes any such change.

title: Rice Helps Red Sox to 97 Victory
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Jim Rice hit two home runs and Carlton Fisk and Dwight Evans hit one apiece tonight, powering the Boston Red Sox to a 97 victory over the Cleveland Indians. The Red Sox had failed to hit a homer in their last six appearances at Fenway Park.
